title: Senior Graphic Designer with Modern Skill with AI Prompting Master Skils and proven experience with Amazon
description:
ABOUT US



Since 2013, Prodigy Media has built more than brands — we've created an Amazon-native empire. With 12 years of proven success and 28+ product lines under our belt, we don't play small. Our mission? Launch culturally resonant, design-led, emotionally sticky products that dominate Amazon and beyond.



Now, we're leveling up — and we want a design assassin who’s mastered AI workflows, commands Midjourney like a wizard, and turns prompts into visual gold.



WHO WE WANT



This is not your average graphic design role. We're looking for a hybrid Creative Director / Prompt Engineer / Graphic Design savant who can:



Think like a marketer. Design like an artist. Prompt like an AI god.



You’ll own the visual storytelling for our brands, using both traditional tools and bleeding-edge AI systems to pump out Amazon-optimized assets that convert.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Craft Ultra-High-Converting Amazon Ads – static, lifestyle, 
-tier, and scroll-stopping. Own A+ Content Design – full module execution with story arcs that build obsession. Design Labels & Packaging – pixel-perfect, regulatory-ready, and unforgettable on the shelf. Prompt, Edit & Produce AI-Generated Visuals – using tools like Midjourney, DALL•E, Runway, Spline, Veo3, Sora, and others. Run 3D Product Renders – via Blender, KeyShot, or AI-powered 3D tools. Develop Scroll-Hook Videos – using After Effects, Premiere, Runway AI, etc.



Systematize Brand Visuals Across 30+ Products – while keeping it all aligned, emotional, and conversion-focused.



WHO YOU ARE



5+ years in design, at least 2+ years in Amazon/e-commerce brand creative

Fluent in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Blender, After Effects

Pro-level Midjourney / AI prompt engineer – this is non-negotiable

Obsessed with Amazon visual psychology, packaging psychology, and design that sells

Able to juggle 10 brands and still hit deadlines

Operate with a Creative Director mindset — not just execution, but strategy

Bonus: Experience creating creative systems, art direction templates, or leading a team



MUST-HAVES

Portfolio with Amazon ads, A+ pages, labels, 3D renders, videos, and AI-gen examples

Real-world use of AI tools integrated into your workflow

Available Mon-Fri 5:00am–2:00pm PST

title: Virtual Assistant (VA)
description:
Full-Time Virtual Assistant (OnlineJobs.ph) — $2.35/hr — 40 hrs/wk



How to apply (please follow these exactly) 

: 

Subject line: Application — Full-Time VA — [Your Name]

Attach your résumé, portfolio, “1st task” & an intro video< 2min. We want to get to know you!



About us

 We’re Bloom — a small, values-driven virtual assistant agency that partners primarily with female entrepreneurs. We help founders launch and scale through organized systems, beautiful content, and reliable day-to-day support. We’re looking for a long-term, full-time VA who’s hungry to grow with our clients and become a dependable member of the team.



Role overview (short)

Position: Full-time Virtual Assistant (remote)

Hours: 40 hours/week (must overlap with US Eastern Time mornings / early afternoons)

Pay: $2.35 USD / hour

Location: Remote

Start date: Rolling / ASAP for the right candidate



What you’ll do (core responsibilities)

Create and edit visually appealing social media content and IG carousels in Canva (templates, resizing, exporting).

Manage
 inboxes: triage, draft replies, label & organize, follow-up reminders.

Organize and maintain Google Drive and Canva folders so everything is easy to find.

Build and manage content calendars (Instagram, LinkedIn) and schedule posts.

Support client communication via Slack and
; escalate issues and log tasks.

Create SOPs, checklists, and Notion/Asana/Notion-style project cards for recurring workflows.

Basic copywriting: short captions, newsletter snippets, social headlines, and subject lines.

Client onboarding support: welcome kits, onboarding checklists, calendar invites.

Light project management: track task progress, follow up with subcontractors, and keep owners updated.

Research & outreach: market research, vendor/client prospecting, event logistics.

Occasional light bookkeeping tasks (invoices, expense logging) and familiarity with bookkeeping processes.

Event support (planning documents, registration lists, venue coordination) when required.



Must-have technical skills

Canva — confident building multi-slide carousels and templates.

Google Workspace — Drive, Docs, Sheets, Calendar (strong organizational skills).

 management — Gmail experience, filters/labels, drafting professional replies.

Notion / Asana / Trello — able to create and maintain project boards and SOPs.

Slack — professional, timely communication and channel etiquette.

Reliable laptop, stable internet (minimum 10 Mbps), and quiet workspace for client calls.



Preferred / nice-to-have

Experience supporting female entrepreneurs, coaches, or small creative businesses.

Social scheduling tools (Meta Business Suite, Later, Buffer) experience.

Basic graphic design sense (layout, typography, image cropping).

Basic bookkeeping experience (QuickBooks, Wave, or simple Excel bookkeeping).

Experience writing/editing long-form captions or newsletter content.

Experience creating pitch materials, promo decks, or Canva slide decks.

Familiarity with Google Sites or simple website content updates.





Soft skills we care about

Extremely reliable and punctual.

Detail-oriented — checks work before sending it.

Proactive — brings solutions, not just problems.

Clear English communication (written + spoken).

Honest, high integrity, and professional when representing clients.

Comfortable receiving feedback and iterating quickly.

Desire for a long-term contract and growth within a team.



What we offer

Stable, 40-hour work week with consistent pay.

Long-term contracts and opportunities to grow into lead VA / specialist roles.

A collaborative, supportive team that values communication and professional growth.

Real, meaningful work supporting mission-driven female entrepreneurs.





Your portfolio should Include 3 Canva examples (links or exported PNGs) of posts/carousels you created. If you don’t have client work, create 3 sample slides showing: a) an Instagram carousel cover + two inner slides, b) a promotional single image, c) a simple 3-slide pitch deck.



In the message, answer these 3 short questions (max 1–2 sentences each):

Do you have consistent overlap with US Eastern Time mornings? (Yes/No + hours available)

What relevant tools do you use daily?

Why do you want to work with female entrepreneurs and our team?



First task: Include either —

A 150–250 word caption for an Instagram carousel about "Why systems free up time for business growth"

A link to a 3-slide Canva carousel or real (public link) you made for a small business.

State your earliest start date and confirm you can commit to 40 hrs/week.



Applications that don’t follow these instructions will not be considered.



Selection process (what to expect)

CV + portfolio screening short written task --> 30-minute interview via Zoom ? Placed into applicant pool/ hired immediately--> work directly with Bloom to fill our VA needs--> subcontractor placement with long term client--> if their work dries up or if it isn’t a good fit, we place you with a new client.



During the trial we’ll assess skills, communication, and cultural fit.

You will hear from us within 5 business days that we have received your application. Within 2 weeks we will let you know where we stand with filling our needs. We are currently filling rolls for immediate placement as well as forming a talent pool for future needs.



Final notes

We value honesty, integrity, growth mindset, and the ability to organize chaos into calm. If you’re a dependable Canva pro who loves helping entrepreneurs look organized and feel supported — apply now.

Looking forward to meeting you

 — please apply to 
 with the subject Application — Full-Time VA — [Your Name].

title: Accounting Supervisor
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

SimpleKeep is a modern US-based accounting company that values our team and creates a fun, dynamic work environment. Our goal is to provide exceptional accounting services to our clients while fostering a positive and supportive team culture. We are a remote team that leverages the latest technology to work together efficiently and effectively.



We're a great company to work for, and a small team, so you'll be able to come in and really have an impact on the way we do business. We're growing, and we’re looking to add an experienced person to our team.



POSITION OVERVIEW:

We’re seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Accounting Supervisor with proficiency in QuickBooks and Xero to join our growing remote team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting, a passion for mentoring and developing staff, and a desire to work in a dynamic and supportive team environment. This is a remote position with flexible work hours.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Supervision and Leadership:

- Manage and oversee daily accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger.

- Mentor and provide guidance to junior accountants and other tea
mbers.

- Conduct performance evaluations and provide feedback to staff.

- Develop and maintain accounting policies and procedures.

2. Financial Reporting:

- Oversee the preparation and analysis of financial statements.

- Ensure timely and accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.

- Provide financial analysis and insights to clients.

3. Bookkeeping and Reconciliation

- Ensure accurate and timely recording of financial transactions.

- Oversee bank reconciliations, accounts payable, and accounts receivable processes.

- Ensure accurate and timely month-end and year-end close processes.

- Prepare financial statements and other financial reports.

4. Budgeting and Forecasting:

- Lead the preparation of budgets and financial forecasts.

- Monitor budget performance and report variances.

5. Tax Compliance:

- Supervise the preparation and filing of tax returns.

- Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local tax regulations.

6. Software Utilization:

- Oversee the use of QuickBooks and Xero for all accounting functions.

- Ensure data integrity and accuracy within these systems.

7. Audit and Compliance:

- Ensure compliance with internal financial and accounting policies and procedures.

- Coordinate and support internal and external audits.

8. Communication:

- Communicate effectively with clients, vendors, and financial institutions.

- Provide clear and concise reports and updates to senior management.

- Ensure excellent English communication within the team and with stakeholders.

- Provide exceptional customer service to clients.

- Collaborate with other departments to streamline processes and improve efficiency.



QUALIFICATIONS:

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

- CPA certification preferred.

- Minimum of 5 years of accounting experience, with at least 2 years in a supervisory role.

- Proficiency in QuickBooks and Xero is mandatory.

- Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting.

- Excellent organizational and time-management skills.

- Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks.

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.

- Experience in managing remote teams and working with US clients.

- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other accounting software.

- Efficient, personable, adaptable, and organized.



WORK ENVIRONMENT:

This is a remote position; candidates must have a reliable internet connection and a dedicated workspace.



BENEFITS:

- Competitive salary and benefits package.

- Flexible work hours and remote work environment.

- Opportunities for growth and advancement.

- A supportive team culture that values work-life balance and employee satisfaction.

- Health card benefit after 9 months of employment.



WORKING SCHEDULE: Tuesday-Saturday 3am-12nn Manila Time



APPLICATION INSTRUCTION:

After you're done reading through the post, if you're ready to apply for the position, please send an
 to 
 sending your
, please be sure to:

- Attach your resume.

- Include a summary of your experience.

We are a remote team that leverages the latest technology to work together efficiently and effectively.



We're a great company to work for, and a small team, so you'll be able to come in and really have an impact on the way we do business. We're growing, and we’re looking to add an experienced person to our team.



POSITION OVERVIEW:

We’re seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Accounting Supervisor with proficiency in QuickBooks and Xero to join our growing remote team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting, a passion for mentoring and developing staff, and a desire to work in a dynamic and supportive team environment. This is a remote position with flexible work hours.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Supervision and Leadership:

- Manage and oversee daily accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger.

- Mentor and provide guidance to junior accountants and other tea
mbers.

- Conduct performance evaluations and provide feedback to staff.

- Develop and maintain accounting policies and procedures.

2. Financial Reporting:

- Oversee the preparation and analysis of financial statements.

- Ensure timely and accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.

- Provide financial analysis and insights to clients.

3. Bookkeeping and Reconciliation

- Ensure accurate and timely recording of financial transactions.

- Oversee bank reconciliations, accounts payable, and accounts receivable processes.

- Ensure accurate and timely month-end and year-end close processes.

- Prepare financial statements and other financial reports.

4. Budgeting and Forecasting:

- Lead the preparation of budgets and financial forecasts.

- Monitor budget performance and report variances.

5. Tax Compliance:

- Supervise the preparation and filing of tax returns.

- Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local tax regulations.

6. Software Utilization:

- Oversee the use of QuickBooks and Xero for all accounting functions.

- Ensure data integrity and accuracy within these systems.

7. Audit and Compliance:

- Ensure compliance with internal financial and accounting policies and procedures.

- Coordinate and support internal and external audits.

8. Communication:

- Communicate effectively with clients, vendors, and financial institutions.

- Provide clear and concise reports and updates to senior management.

- Ensure excellent English communication within the team and with stakeholders.

- Provide exceptional customer service to clients.

- Collaborate with other departments to streamline processes and improve efficiency.



QUALIFICATIONS:

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

- CPA certification preferred.

- Minimum of 5 years of accounting experience, with at least 2 years in a supervisory role.

- Proficiency in QuickBooks and Xero is mandatory.

- Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting.

- Excellent organizational and time-management skills.

- Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks.

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.

- Experience in managing remote teams and working with US clients.

- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other accounting software.

- Efficient, personable, adaptable, and organized.



WORK ENVIRONMENT:

This is a remote position; candidates must have a reliable internet connection and a dedicated workspace.



BENEFITS:

- Competitive salary and benefits package.

- Flexible work hours and remote work environment.

- Opportunities for growth and advancement.

- A supportive team culture that values work-life balance and employee satisfaction.

- Health card benefit after 9 months of employment.



WORKING SCHEDULE: Tuesday-Saturday 3am-12nn Manila Time

 to 
 sending your
, please be sure to:

- Include a summary of your experience.

title: US Tax Preparer & Bookkeeper
description:
Job Title: US Tax Preparer & Bookkeeper

Location: Remote

Job Type: Part-time

Starting Rate: $6.00/hour (Increase after 90-day performance review)



We are seeking a reliable, detail-oriented professional to join our growing team. If you have real experience with US tax preparation and QuickBooks bookkeeping and enjoy working in an organized, systems-driven environment, we encourage you to apply.



Overview

We are looking for a dedicated US Tax Preparer & Bookkeeper to support our accounting and tax operations. In this role, you will prepare individual and business tax returns, maintain accurate financial records, and help ensure clients’ books are clean and tax-ready year-round.

This position is ideal for someone who is accurate, dependable, and proactive, with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.



Job Details

As a US Tax Preparer & Bookkeeper, you will manage tax preparation and bookkeeping tasks for multiple clients, maintain organized documentation, and support efficient workflows. Your work will play a key role in ensuring compliance, accuracy, and a smooth tax process for our clients.



What You’ll Be Doing

Tax Preparation & Compliance

Prepare Individual Tax Returns (Form 1040) and related schedules

Prepare Business Tax Returns (1120, 1120S, 1065)

Handle State and Franchise Tax filings

Review financial records to ensure accuracy and tax readiness

Identify missing information and communicate with the team as needed

Maintain organized digital tax workpapers and documentation



Bookkeeping & Financial Management

Perform bookkeeping using QuickBooks Online

Categorize transactions accurately

Reconcile bank and credit card accounts

Clean up and correct incomplete or messy books when necessary

Prepare monthly financial reports (Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet)

Ensure books remain accurate and ready for tax filing



Data Entry & Administrative Support

Perform accurate data entry and document management

Upload and organize client files using consistent naming and folder structures

Track tasks and meet internal deadlines

Assist with administrative support related to tax and accounting operations



Systems & Process Improvement

Follow and help improve internal workflows and checklists

Create SOPs and process documentation when needed

Identify opportunities to improve efficiency or reduce errors



What You Bring to the Role

Proven experience preparing US individual and business tax returns

Experience with QuickBooks Online

Experience with TaxSlayer or similar US tax software

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent time management and organizational skills

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines



Preferred Qualifications

Experience handling Franchise Taxes

Previous experience working with a US accounting or tax firm



What You Can Expect

Starting rate of $6.00/hour

Performance review after 90 days with opportunity for a pay increase

Long-term position with growth potential

Stable workload and supportive team environment

Opportunity to expand responsibilities based on performance



About the Company

We are a growing accounting and tax services company focused on providing accurate, reliable, and efficient support to our clients. Our goal is to build a strong remote team that values integrity, accountability, and continuous improvement. We believe in long-term relationships and creating opportunities for team members to grow with the company.

If you have real US tax preparation experience and are looking for a long-term remote opportunity, we encourage you to apply.

title: HubSpot CRM Developer
description:
We are looking for a HubSpot CRM Developer to work with us on an independent contractor basis.



This is not an employment role. The engagement is outcome-driven, with clearly defined deliverables and timelines. The contractor is expected to work independently, manage their own schedule, and remain reasonably available during agreed working hours for coordination and reviews.



We are looking for someone with solid, hands-on experience working with HubSpot CRM on real projects. This includes configuring objects and properties, building workflows, automations, and pipelines, and implementing custom logic beyond basic out-of-the-box setup. You should be comfortable working in live production portals and client-facing environments and taking responsibility for the quality, stability, and data integrity of your work.



The role requires a strong understanding of HubSpot core concepts, including CRM objects (contacts, companies, deals, tickets), custom properties, pipelines, workflow automation, and lists/segmentation. You should be able to work confidently with HubSpot’s workflow builder, custom code actions (using JavaScript in HubSpot Functions where needed), and have practical knowledge of APIs and webhooks to integrate HubSpot with third-party systems. A working understanding of HubSpot user permissions, data model design, and how HubSpot interacts with external tools in a typical B2B stack is important.



You should also be comfortable configuring and working with commonly used HubSpot Sales and Marketing tools, including forms, CTAs, sequences,
 templates, and basic reporting. Routine operational tasks such as maintaining data hygiene, managing imports/exports, updating properties, monitoring workflow performance, and handling basic performance or deliverability issues should be familiar to you. Experience with custom integrations (for example, connecting HubSpot with other CRMs, ticketing tools, or data platforms) is a plus, as long as you understand the underlying API behavior and are not fully dependent on prebuilt connectors.



We value reliability, clear communication, and consistency. This role is best suited for someone who takes ownership of delivery, estimates effort realistically, communicates clearly when there are blockers, and does not require close supervision to move work forward.



The contractor will use their own tools and methods and will not be entitled to employee benefits. Long-term collaboration is possible based on performance and mutual fit.

title: Social Media Growth Manager
description:
Job Title: Social Media Growth Manager

Location: Remote (Philippines Only)

Job Type: Part-Time

Compensation: $4.00 to $6.00 per hour + Performance-Based Bonuses (Growth & Revenue Incentives)



We are seeking a highly skilled, results-driven Social Media Growth Manager to help scale multiple brands across industries including real estate, healthcare, tax services, beauty/wellness, ecommerce, digital products, and service-based businesses.



Overview

We are looking for an elite-level marketing professional who can manage and grow multiple brands simultaneously. Your primary mission is to increase followers, boost engagement, drive conversions, and build automated systems that support long-term business growth.

This role is ideal for someone who is strategic, proactive, highly organized, and comfortable being accountable for measurable results.



Job Details

As a Social Media Growth Manager, you will oversee the growth, content strategy, automation, and monetization of multiple social media accounts. Your work will directly impact audience growth, lead generation, sales performance, and brand visibility across several businesses.

What You’ll Be Doing

Social Media Growth & Viral Marketing

Manage and grow accounts across:


Instagram

TikTok

YouTube

LinkedIn

Pinterest

/X

Responsibilities include:

Developing and executing viral content strategies

Researching trends and viral opportunities daily

Creating content calendars and optimizing posting schedules

Increasing engagement (comments, shares, saves)

Managing comments, messages, and community interactions

Implementing influencer collaborations and partnerships

Running giveaways and engagement campaigns

Monitoring analytics and continuously improving performance

Business Scaling & Revenue Growth (High Priority)

Build and optimize marketing funnels

Create lead generation systems

Improve conversion rates

Launch digital offers and campaigns

Develop upsell and automation strategies

Increase customer lifetime value

Identify new revenue opportunities

Build audience acquisition systems

Scale ecommerce and service-based sales

Support the growth of multiple businesses simultaneously

Content Creation & Creative Direction

Design high-performing content using Canva

Create reels, shorts, and viral videos

Edit and repurpose content across platforms

Write engaging captions and marketing copy

Create thumbnails, graphics, and carousel posts

Produce high-converting ad creatives

Repurpose long-form content into short-form formats

AI & Automation Implementation

Use AI tools (ChatGPT and others) for content and marketing workflows

Build automated posting systems

Create AI-powered content pipelines

Implement marketing automation tools

Improve productivity and efficiency using AI

Analytics & Performance Tracking

Track key performance indicators (KPIs)

Monitor audience growth and engagement

Analyze conversion and revenue data

Provide weekly performance reports

Run A/B tests and optimize campaigns

Identify opportunities for improvement

Marketing & Branding Strategy

Position brands for authority and visibility

Maintain brand consistency across platforms

Develop and execute campaign strategies

Support new product and service launches

Assist with overall business growth and expansion



What You Bring to the Role

Required (Non-Negotiable)

Advanced social media marketing experience

Proven results growing social media audiences

Experience creating viral content

Canva expertise

Experience using AI tools (ChatGPT or similar)

Strong short-form video strategy knowledge

Understanding of marketing funnels and conversions

Strong copywriting skills

Excellent English communication

Strong organization and multitasking ability

Experience managing multiple brands

Proactive, self-starter mindset



Preferred Qualifications

TikTok growth expertise

Shopify or ecommerce marketing experience

 marketing automation

Funnel-building tools (ClickFunnels, GoHighLevel, etc.)

Meta Ads or TikTok Ads experience

Influencer marketing

SEO knowledge

Digital product marketing

Affiliate marketing systems

Work Schedule

Part-time position

Must overlap with US business hours

Daily communication required

Weekly performance reporting required



What You Can Expect

Competitive base salary

Performance-based bonuses tied to growth and revenue

Long-term career opportunity

Opportunity to grow into leadership roles

Direct collaboration with business leadership

Work with multiple fast-growing brands



About the Company

We are a rapidly growing company focused on scaling multiple businesses across several industries. Our goal is to build high-performing brands with strong online visibility, consistent lead generation, and scalable revenue systems.

We are building a long-term team of growth-focused professionals who are driven by results, innovation, and continuous improvement.

If you are a serious growth expert who knows how to create viral 
ntum and scale brands, we encourage you to apply.

title: Operations & Workflow Specialist
description:
Are you looking to make a career change? Are you passionate about working with nonprofits? Maybe you have taken some time off and now you want to pivot your skills into a more tech-savvy field but aren’t sure how. Nonprofit Megaphone is a remote, home-based company with a paid hands-on training program to amplify nonprofit voices! 



Nonprofit Megaphone empowers organizations to expand their reach and impact by assisting them in obtaining and effectively managing the Google Ad Grant. Through this grant, nonprofits are able to share their stories with a wider global audience. Our team was recently recognized by Inc. Magazine on the Inc. 500 List as one of the fastest-growing companies in America. 



At Nonprofit Megaphone, our team is 100% remote, so we are one of the few companies where working from home is the rule, not the exception. Because we are remote, we take team culture very seriously. Nonprofit Megaphone also understands the need for portable and flexible careers and proudly supports military spouse employment through the Hiring Our Heroes #DiscoverTheTalent initiative.



Position Specifics: Contract position, full-time, hourly position, 9:00-5:00 M-F within EST, CST, MST, or PST time zones.



Perks:



Robust On The Job Training: With Nonprofit Megaphone’s hands-on training you will learn new career skills, in-demand tech knowledge, and gain the confidence needed to transition and thrive in your new career. There is no need for direct experience!

Earn While You Learn: During your first 90 days you’ll be paid while you learn each new skill and technology.



Remote First Culture: We thrive in our remote environment and want you to as well. We spend time getting to know one another and building relationships both virtually and in person.



Growth: Nonprofit Megaphone recognizes great assets when we see them. Our employees have the ability to continue their learning and growth through ongoing training and development.



Workplace Cohesion: We are a no drama llama environment and strive to build and support an atmosphere that is centered around inclusivity, honesty, drive, and transparency. As part of our commitment to fostering transparency and collaboration, we also offer open office hours once a week with our leadership team, which anyone is welcome to join. 

 

Compensation & Benefits:

- $5 USD per hour.

- 11 Federally Paid Holidays.

- An optional soft close week which falls between Christmas Eve and New Year’s Day to give our employees time to rest, relax, and recharge before the new year.

- A $175 USD instant starting balance in your Tech and Wellness Stipend account upon successful completion of your 90-day review. You will then start receiving a $7 USD monthly recurring injection on your 1-year anniversary.



Job Summary:

As an Enterprise Service Specialist, you’ll support the operational side of our Enterprise Services team — ensuring smooth, profitable, and high-quality delivery of services like Visito
, SEO, and future Enterprise Services. 



You’ll be responsible for onboarding, technical setup, workflow management, and back-end problem solving that allows our team to serve nonprofit clients efficiently and effectively. 



You’ll collaborate closely with the Head of Enterprise Services, Advisors, and other tea
mbers to maintain seamless operations, troubleshoot issues, and continually improve service profitability and client satisfaction.



Key Responsibilities & Duties:

- Support onboarding and back-end operations for Enterprise Services (Visito
, SEO, and other future services).

- Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve service-related issues promptly (or delegate as needed).

- Document and optimize workflows for quality, efficiency, and repeatability.

- Collaborate with Enterprise Service Advisors and internal teams to ensure exceptional client experiences.

- Set up client accounts for Enterprise Services and oversee or troubleshoot additional setups.

- Support automation tools such as Zapier and Make, ensuring reliable backend performance.

- Communicate confidently with clients, vendors, and teammates about technical aspects of Enterprise Services.

- Complete assigned projects and tasks on time and with precision.

- Proactively share ideas with the Head of Enterprise Services to improve team profitability and performance.



Qualifications:

- Complete fluency in the English language, including spelling of words, rules of composition, and proper grammar.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

- Comfortable with technology, including competence with computers, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Hubspot, and the willingness to learn more tools and systems (Asana, Make, Zapier) 

- Ability to learn quickly and work independently in a remote setting.

- Excellent time management skills and a home environment that supports working remotely.

- Ability to receive constructive criticism and feedback on your work and a constant willingness to improve.

- Ability to analyze data and information and identify the underlying principles, reasons, and facts behind it.

- Maintain a good attitude and positivity with tea
mbers.

- Ability to stay organized, juggle multiple priorities as needed, and complete tasks quickly and accurately.

- Strong need for attention to detail and the ability to proofread your own work quickly and accurately.

- Actively contributing in tea
etings.

- Being flexible in your role as priorities or best practices change. 

- Always follow our core values: Growth Champion, Results, Always Honorable, No Drama (Llama), and Team Player.



Tech Requirements:

- Quiet, distraction-free environment for phone calls/meetings.

- Typing speed of 60+ words per minute.

- A computer with audio and visual capabilities for on-video Zoo
etings with strong internet connectivity.



Note to Applicants:



This job description is a general overview and will evolve as the company grows and adapts to new needs.



As part of our hiring process, all applicants must complete and pass our four assessments: Critical Thinking, Typing Test, Computer/Tech Skills, and Grammar. These assessments provide valuable insights and help us ensure a good match for both you and the role. We believe they make the process more objective, and if you don't perform well, the job might not be a great fit for you.



To apply for this role:



Please submit your application through this form: 



Important: All sections of the form must be completed for your application to be considered.

At Nonprofit Megaphone, our team is 100% remote, so we are one of the few companies where working from home is the rule, not the exception. Because we are remote, we take team culture very seriously. Nonprofit Megaphone also understands the need for portable and flexible careers and proudly supports military spouse employment through the Hiring Our Heroes #DiscoverTheTalent initiative.



Position Specifics: Contract position, full-time, hourly position, 9:00-5:00 M-F within EST, CST, MST, or PST time zones.



Perks:



Robust On The Job Training: With Nonprofit Megaphone’s hands-on training you will learn new career skills, in-demand tech knowledge, and gain the confidence needed to transition and thrive in your new career. There is no need for direct experience!

Earn While You Learn: During your first 90 days you’ll be paid while you learn each new skill and technology.



Remote First Culture: We thrive in our remote environment and want you to as well. We spend time getting to know one another and building relationships both virtually and in person.



Growth: Nonprofit Megaphone recognizes great assets when we see them. Our employees have the ability to continue their learning and growth through ongoing training and development.



Workplace Cohesion: We are a no drama llama environment and strive to build and support an atmosphere that is centered around inclusivity, honesty, drive, and transparency. As part of our commitment to fostering transparency and collaboration, we also offer open office hours once a week with our leadership team, which anyone is welcome to join. 

 

Compensation & Benefits:

- $5 USD per hour.

- 11 Federally Paid Holidays.

- An optional soft close week which falls between Christmas Eve and New Year’s Day to give our employees time to rest, relax, and recharge before the new year.

- A $175 USD instant starting balance in your Tech and Wellness Stipend account upon successful completion of your 90-day review. You will then start receiving a $7 USD monthly recurring injection on your 1-year anniversary.



Job Summary:

As an Enterprise Service Specialist, you’ll support the operational side of our Enterprise Services team — ensuring smooth, profitable, and high-quality delivery of services like Visito
, SEO, and future Enterprise Services. 



You’ll be responsible for onboarding, technical setup, workflow management, and back-end problem solving that allows our team to serve nonprofit clients efficiently and effectively.

mbers.

etings.

title: Short-Form Video Producer (HeyGen Avatar + Higgsfield B-roll + CapCut)
description:
We’re hiring a short-form video producer + scriptwriter to scale our content.

Our audience is senior product leaders and founders. They’re smart, time-poor, and allergic to fluff.

Our job is to clarify decisions, steady the team, and make one idea land. Sometimes that looks serious. Sometimes it’s lighter. It never looks chaotic.



What you’ll produce (30–60s)

- Reels / TikTok / Shorts built around:

- A consistent HeyGen AI avatar (same “host” across episodes)

- Higgsfield B-roll creation (screens, situations, proof 
nts, environmental inserts)

- CapCut (or equivalent) editing for pacing, continuity, and polish

- Captions are required (caption copy, not optional)

- Each video delivers one clear idea:

- a decision reframe

- a common failure mode

- a tradeoff teams miss

- a next step that reduces rework



Tone range

- Grounded and calm

- Witty, not cute

- Inspiring through clarity, not motivation



Your responsibilities (must-haves)

- Scriptwriting (hooks, beats, payoff, landing)

- Generate/assemble B-roll in Higgsfield to support the point (show proof, not just talking)

- Build avatar scenes in HeyGen with consistent look, energy, and framing

- Edit in CapCut or equivalent:

- tight pacing

- clean audio

- intentional pauses

- continuity so it feels designed, not stitched

- Write posting-ready captions that extend the idea (no clichés, no influencer language)

- Deliver exports optimized for IG (9:16, clean audio mix, readable on-screen text when needed)



Tools / stack (required)

- HeyGen (AI avatar)

- Higgsfield (B-roll creation)

- CapCut / Premiere / AE (editing)

- Strong scriptwriting for short-form

- Plus (nice-to-have):

- Veo3

- Grok (or adjacent AI tooling for ideation/workflow)



What “good” looks like

- The hook lands in the first 1–2 seconds

- Visuals change intentionally (no single-location monotony)

- The avatar feels like one recognizable host

- B-roll proves the point (screens, artifacts, 
nts), not generic filler

- Captions feel like something a senior PM would save and reuse



How to apply

Send:

- 2–3 examples of short-form you’ve produced (include one that uses AI video if you have it)

- Your workflow across: script ? HeyGen ? Higgsfield ? edit ? caption

- Confirm you can deliver: scriptwriting + B-roll creation + edit + caption

- Your rate (per video and/or weekly batch) and weekly capacity

title: Senior QA Automation Lead (SaaS / Azure / React / .NET)
description:
We are hiring a Senior QA Automation Lead to own quality assurance and SDLC enforcement across modern cloud-native SaaS platforms built with:



- .NET Core (7/8)

- Azure infrastructure

- Azure SQL Database

- React / Next.js (TypeScript)

- Microservices architecture

- Azure DevOps CI/CD

- AI-integrated workflows



In addition to following through with proper testing against development tasks, you will be responsible for automated regression, API validation, release gating, and ensuring disciplined SDLC practices across the development lifecycle.



Core Responsibilities



- Own and enforce QA standards across the full SDLC

- Define and maintain Definition of Done requirements

- Develop structured test plans and test cases for all features

- Build and maintain automated regression test suites (UI + API)

- Implement API-level testing (Postman / automation frameworks)

- Validate multi-tenant data isolation and RBAC controls

- Test asynchronous workflows (queues, background jobs, webhooks)

- Validate AI-driven outputs against defined acceptance criteria

- Work closely with developers and PM during sprint planning

- Review developer tickets to ensure proper test coverage

- Manage staging validation before production release

- Gate production deployments based on QA approval

- Maintain QA dashboards tracking regression status and defect trends

- Participate in CI/CD pipeline validation

- Perform database validation testing (Azure SQL)

- Identify security, permission, and access control vulnerabilities

- Document test coverage and release validation reports



Required Skills

SaaS & Architecture



- 5+ years QA experience in production SaaS environments

- Experience testing multi-tenant systems

- Strong understanding of RBAC and permission testing

- API-first testing experience

- Understanding of microservices architecture



Automation

- Experience with UI automation (Playwright preferred, Cypress acceptable)

- API automation testing experience

- Regression test suite management

- CI/CD test integration (Azure DevOps preferred)



Cloud & Infrastructure



- Understanding of Azure App Services

- Azure SQL validation and query testing

- Azure Service Bus or async processing awareness

- Knowledge of logging and monitoring systems



AI & Async Systems



- Experience validating AI or non-deterministic outputs (Cursor)

- Testing of background job processing

- Webhook validation

- Retry and idempotency testing



DevOps & Process



- Experience working inside structured SDLC environments

- Ability to enforce release checklists

- Comfortable blocking releases if quality standards are not met

- Experience working within sprint-based teams (Asana preferred)



Preferred Qualifications



- Experience working in SOC2-aware or security-focused teams

- Familiarity with CursorAI or AI-augmented development workflows

- Performance and load testing exposure

- Experience building QA dashboards and reporting metrics



You will : 



- Own quality standards across development

- Ensure every feature meets defined acceptance criteria

- Maintain automated regression coverage

- Protect production stability

- Partner closely with engineering and PM

- Operate independently with strong technical judgment

, phone, or video.

title: PPC Expert for Shopify Ecommerce Store (B2B + D2C, PMAX, Google Shopping)
description:
Summary

We are looking for an experienced Google Ads PPC Specialist to manage and scale paid search for our Shopify-based ecommerce store. Our business serves both D2C customers and B2B/industrial OEM buyers, so strong experience in demand generation across both segments is essential.



You'll be responsible for refining our campaign structure, improving profitability, optimizing lead quality, and scaling our top-performing channels (Performance Max + Google Shopping).



This is a part-time (approximately 15 hours per week), ongoing engagement with weekly collaboration and bi-weekly reporting.



Responsibilities

-Core PPC Management

Manage and optimize Google Search, PMAX, and Google Shopping campaigns

-Build separate B2B vs. D2C funnels with clean keyword segmentation

Implement robust negative keyword strategies to prevent irrelevant traffic

-Conduct weekly keyword, search term, and placement optimizations

-Improve ROAS, lead quality, and conversion rate across all campaigns





Tracking & Analytics

-Audit and improve conversion tracking (GA4, enhanced conversions)

-Verify correct UTM tracking for purchases, form fills, RFQs, and B2B leads

-Set up custom reporting dashboards (Looker Studio)





Creative & Feed Optimization

-Advise on PMAX asset improvements, creative refresh cadence, and audience signals

-Optimize product feed for Google Shopping (titles, attributes, categories)





Reporting & Communication

-Provide bi-weekly performance reports with actionable insights

-Give clear recommendations for scaling, reallocation, and testing

-Communicate proactively about issues, opportunities, or performance shifts





Requirements

-4+ years managing Shopify E-commerce + Google Ads

-Proven expertise with Performance Max and Google Shopping

-Strong background in B2B demand generation (industrial/manufacturing highly preferred)

-Strong understanding of D2C ecommerce funnels (arts, crafts and DIY highly preferred)

-Proficiency with keyword research, auction insights, and segmentation

-Experience with GA4, tags, enhanced conversions, and remarketing

-Strong analytical skills and the ability to turn data into strategy

 -Fluent English + clear communicator



Bonus:

-Experience with SimilarWeb, SEMrush, Google Keyword Planner or keyword gap analysis

-Knowledge of OEM/industrial markets





What Success Looks Like

?Increased ROAS for PMAX + Shopping

Higher-quality B2B leads at efficient CPA

?Reduction of wasted ad spend on irrelevant queries

?Stronger segmentation between D2C and B2B audiences

?Clear, consistent reporting and transparent communication (Must be available on EST time zone)

title: Christian Design & Marketing Assistant (Photoshop, Shopify, Klaviyo)
description:
Join a mission-driven team creating faith-inspired artwork seen by millions worldwide. We’re looking for a Design & Marketing Assistant skilled in Photoshop, Shopify, and Klaviyo to help us create visuals and optimize marketing campaigns.



Please read this posting carefully — attention to detail is an important part of this role.



About God’s fingerprints

Our mission is to declare the truth of God’s Word through artwork. Since launching in 2016, we’ve sold 200,000+ art prints to customers in 50+ countries and reached over 3 million people through our website and social platforms. Everything we do is guided by our core values — Christ-centered, Integrity, and Excellence. We are a small, passionate team committed to sharing God’s truth through art. The verse that inspires everything we do is Isaiah 55:10–11, which reminds us that God’s Word always accomplishes His purposes. If you love Jesus, have a strong eye for design, and enjoy problem-solving in a growing, entrepreneurial environment, we’d love to hear from you.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a Design & Marketing Assistant to help create visual assets and optimize our marketing efforts. You’ll work closely with our founder to:

- Create compelling product images and visuals

- Build lifestyle mockups using templates and AI tools

- Manage
 and SMS campaigns

- Update product pages and blog posts

- Support A/B testing for website layouts and
 flows



Key Responsibilities

- Create
 campaigns in Klaviyo, adding content, images, and placeholders

- Manage
 flows in Klaviyo, including A/B testing subject lines, layouts, and offers

- Create and schedule SMS campaigns

- Create product images using existing artwork assets

- Develop lifestyle imagery using templates and AI tools

- Adapt existing designs for
 ads, Instagram,
, and website

- Build Instagram Story templates with Scripture-based quotes and branded designs

- Resize and repurpose ad creatives across multiple dimensions and platforms

- Create and update product pages in Shopify

- Build and format blog posts, integrating images and internal links

- Set up and analyze website A/B tests using Shoplift



Key Skills & Experience (Required)

- Strong Photoshop skills with a clean, modern aesthetic

- Experience with Shopify for product pages and/or blog posts

- Understanding of UX/UI design for e-commerce

- Must be a practicing Christian and comfortable working with Scripture-based content

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive in problem-solving

- Self-starter who can work independently and take initiative



Key Skills & Experience (Preferred)

- Experience with Klaviyo or similar
 marketing tools

- Familiarity with A/B testing tools (Shoplift experience is a bonus)

- Experience working with DTC e-commerce brands

- Experience working with AI tools for creative generation

- Familiarity with Meta ad platforms and resizing creatives



Tools You'll Use

- Photoshop

- Shopify

- Klaviyo

- Shoplift

- AI tools for image generation



Why You’ll Love Working With Us

- Be part of a mission-driven brand sharing God’s Word worldwide

- Use your creative skills to make an eternal impact

- Collaborate with a supportive, faith-aligned team

- Gain hands-on experience in DTC e-commerce and marketing

- Enjoy a flexible, remote-first work environment



Compensation

~$1,000 USD per month

~10–20 hours per week

Potential to grow into a full-time role if it’s a strong fit



To be considered for this role, please include the following numbered responses in your application:

1. Briefly describe your most relevant experience and how it prepares you for this role.

2. Our mission is to 'declare the truth of God’s Word through artwork'. Does this mission resonate with you? If so, please share why.

3. Why do you want to work as a Design & Marketing Assistant for God's fingerprints?

4. What verse inspires everything that God’s fingerprints does? (Hint: the answer is in this job post.)

title: Administrative Assistant (C-Level)
description:
We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and results-oriented Administrative Assistant to provide comprehensive support to our team.



The ideal candidate is a self-starter who takes full ownership of tasks, proactively solves problems before they escalate, and streamlines processes to ensure the team operates at peak efficiency. You must be comfortable handling phone and video calls and managing sensitive information with absolute discretion.



Key Responsibilities:

Manage assigned projects from start to finish with minimal oversight.

Actively manage calendars, meetings, and travel with an eye for priority alignment.

Keep tea
mbers accountable for deliverables and ensure deadlines are met.

Identify and implement workflow improvements to increase team productivity.

Use Google Workspace, ClickUp, and Slack to keep projects progressing smoothly.

Conduct research and prepare data-driven reports or presentations.



Requirements:

Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as an administrative assistant or similar role.

High proficiency in Google Workspace, ClickUp, and Slack is required.

Strong professional demeanor in both written and verbal communication.

Absolute confidentiality when handling sensitive information.

Self-motivated, adaptable, and a dedicated results-driven professional.

Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required.



How to Apply (Required)



Your application must include the following two items:



1. Updated Resume: Please attach your current resume in PDF format.

2. 3-Minute Introduction Video: Please provide a video (max 3 minutes) or a link (Loom, Google Drive, or Unlisted YouTube) covering:



-Your name and age.

-A brief overview of your professional background and work experience.

Specific examples of how you have used work tools in previous roles.



Note: Applications missing the video component will not be reviewed. We are looking for someone who follows directions perfectly and brings a high level of organization to the table!

title: Helpdesk Technician | PM Shift (LH)
description:
Helpdesk Technician (L2/L3) | EST/EDT Time Zone

 Working Days:      Monday - Friday

 Working Hours:     4:00PM – 12:30AM



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Type:  Full-Time

Rate: $5.00 – $9.00 USD per hour (Depending on Experience)



<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO COMPLETE THE

FULL INSTRUCTIONS WILL BE CONSIDERED

<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>





COMPANY SUMMARY

- - - - - - - - 



We are a US-based Managed IT Service Provider (MSP) specializing in IT Support, Cybersecurity, Cloud Solutions, and Compliance for businesses nationwide. We are headquartered in New Jersey and serve SMBs and regulated industries that demand high security, reliability, and exceptional support.



We value:

> Integrity and honesty (dishonesty of any form is not tolerated)

> Accountability

> Professionalism

> A team culture built on trust, communication, and continuous improvement



We operate in a fast-paced, collaborative environment supporting mission-critical technology for our clients. We value proactive, detail-oriented, and dependable individuals who take pride in delivering high-quality work.





POSITION SUMMARY

- - - - - - - - 



We are seeking Level 2/3 Helpdesk Technicians to deliver high-quality remote IT support to our business clients. This is a fast-paced, client-facing role requiring strong troubleshooting skills, exceptional communication, and deep familiarity with MSP tools and workflows.



You will resolve Level 1 and Level 2 issues, assist with projects, collaborate with our ConnectWise NOC, and interact with SaaS vendors and software support teams. Technicians must maintain a security-first mindset in all work.



You will respond to and resolve issues such as:

• Business application support (M365, SaaS apps, Azure AD)

• Microsoft Admin Portal / Entra / Azure issues

• Google Workspace support

•
 delivery issues (client + server side)

• Firewall/UTM configuration changes

• Credential issues, password resets, MFA configuration

• PC performance and system troubleshooting

• Printer/scanner issues

• VPN and remote access problems



This is an after-hours role designed to support clients during evening operations and maintenance windows.



** Must have excellent English writing and speaking skills and be comfortable supporting clients on the phone all day. **







KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- - - - - - - - 



• Provide Level 1 and Level 2 technical support to business clients.

• Diagnose and resolve issues related to servers, workstations, M365, Azure, networking, and cloud apps.

• Triage, update, and close tickets using ConnectWise Manage.

• Work closely with our ConnectWise NOC/helpdesk and internal team.

• Communicate clearly with clients in a professional, friendly manner.

• Assist with projects, migrations, and automation as needed.

• Work with software and SaaS vendors to resolve client issues.

• Maintain accurate documentation in IT Glue.

• Follow all security-first best practices.

• Ensure ticket notes are detailed, client-ready, and updated in real time.

• Maintain daily workflow discipline (board cleanup, ticket follow-up, mailbox cleanup, etc.).





REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

- - - - - - - - 



• Proven MSP experience (Level 2 required)

• Strong English communication (written + verbal)

• Deep understanding of troubleshooting Windows, networks, and cloud environments

• Ability to diagnose and resolve issues independently and efficiently

• Proficiency with:

  -- ConnectWise Manage (PSA)

  -- ConnectWise Asio / Automate (RMM)

  -- IT Glue Documentation

  -- Microsoft 365 Admin Centers (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams)

  -- Entra ID / Azure AD (Identity, groups, MFA, SSO, access policies)

  -- Azure (VMs, networking, storage – preferred)

  -- Google Workspace

  -- Firewall portals: Sophos, SonicWall, Todyl (preferred)



• Strong understanding of networking fundamentals (DNS, DHCP, routing, VLANs, VPN)

• Ability to follow SOPs and update documentation clearly & accurately

• Must demonstrate STRONG INTEGRITY, HONESTY, and ACCOUNTABILITY in all work





PREFERRED SKILLS (Bonus but not required)

- - - - - - - - 



• 2+ years technical support experience

• Experience with Intune, Endpoint Manager, M365 Compliance

• Experience with Ubiquiti hardware and cloud controllers

• Familiarity with IT Glue, Confluence, or ITBoost

• PowerShell scripting and command-line experience

• API/Webhook configuration experience

• Prior ConnectWise helpdesk experience (major plus)

• Vendor certifications (Microsoft, Cisco, SonicWall, Sophos, CompTIA)





CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

- - - - - - - - 



• CompTIA A+ required within 1 year of hire

• Any 2 Microsoft certifications required within 1 year of hire





HOME OFFICE REQUIREMENTS

- - - - - - - - 



> Dedicated work area (quiet, distraction-free & video appropriate)

> Backup power (UPS or similar)

> Stable internet: 10 Mbps minimum

> Modern PC (currently 12GB+ RAM, Intel i5+ CPU and SSD)

> Modern Windows OS (currently Windows 11 Pro)

> Dual Monitors (3 monitors preferred)

> Webcam (must be on during all internal calls and meetings)

> Noise-cancelling headset

> Mobile phone for MFA





WORK SCHEDULE

- - - - - - - - 



SHIFT: AFTER HOURS

- Monday - Friday: 4:00PM – 12:30AM EST (US Time)

- 30-minute lunch break (unpaid)









BENEFITS

- - - - - - - - 



> Work From Home

> Work/Life Balance

> Supportive and appreciative team culture

> Medical Insurance Reimbursement after 90 days (full-time only)

> 13th Month Pay

> PTO - Paid Time Off (full-time only)

> Paid US Holidays





HOW TO APPLY

- - - - - - - - 

NOTE - > ALL steps required. Incomplete applications are automatically rejected





1 — Confirm you have Level 2 MSP Experience

2 — Upload your Resume

3 — Submit a short video at your work desk explaining why you're a great fit

    * MUST say “Blueclone Networks” in the video * 



4 — In your video, answer:

  > A. What MSP experience do you have?

  > B. What MSP tools have you used (PSA, RMM, documentation, etc.)?

  > C. What M365, Entra, and Azure experience do you have?

  > D. What hourly rate are you seeking (USD)?



5 — Submit all materials only through OnlineJobs.ph (no
 submissions)



6 — Must use a minimum of 5 Apply Points



-#-#-#-#-#-#-#-

Important Note

-#-#-#-#-#-#-#-



The company has a ZERO-TOLERANCE POLICY for dishonesty prior to and during employment.

If you provide false information, plagiarize work samples, use AI inappropriately without disclosure, or misrepresent your experience, your application will be immediately rejected and permanently blocked.



TAGS:

Helpdesk, Technical Support, IT Support, MSP, Managed Service Provider, ConnectWise, IT Glue, Microsoft 365, Azure AD, After Hours Support, Evening Shift, Graveyard Shift Philippines, IT Support Specialist, Remote Connection, VPN Support, End User Support, Tier 2 Support

title: SOC Engineer (Level 2)
description:
Please apply for this job here: 



JOB SUMMARY

We are looking for an experienced SOC Engineer - Level 2 to join our Security Operations Center (SOC) team. As a Level 2 SOC Engineer, you will play a critical role in monitoring, analyzing, and responding to security i
. You will be responsible for handling more complex security threats, guiding Level 1 engineers, and contributing to the overall security posture of the organization. This role requires strong technical expertise, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Advanced Threat Detection and Response: Monitor and analyze security alerts and i
, conduct in-depth investigations, and respond to complex security threats, ensuring they are mitigated effectively.

• I
 Management: Take the lead in managing security i
, coordinating with other IT and security teams to contain, eradicate, and recover from security breaches.

• Forensic Analysis: Perform detailed forensic analysis on compromised systems to identify root causes, attack vectors, and indicators of compromise (IOCs).

• Vulnerability Management: Assist in the identification, assessment, and remediation of vulnerabilities within the organization’s infrastructure.

• Security Tool Management: Maintain and optimize security tools and technologies, including SIEM, IDS/IPS, firewalls, and endpoint protection systems.

• Collaboration: Work closely with Level 1 SOC Engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and training to help them improve their skills and effectiveness in responding to security i
.

• Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of security i
, forensic analysis, and response actions, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.

• Reporting: Generate and analyze security reports, providing insights and recommendations to improve the organization’s security posture.

• Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on the latest cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and best practices, and contribute to the ongoing improvement of SOC processes and technologies.

• On-Call Support: Participate in a rotating on-call schedule to provide after-hours support for critical security i
.



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

Proven expertise in the following areas is required: 

- Strong knowledge of security monitoring tools (e.g., SIEM, IDS/IPS) and their configuration and management.

- Proficiency in network security, endpoint security, and i
 response techniques.

- Experience with forensic tools and methodologies for analyzing compromised systems.

- Familiarity with scripting and automation (e.g., Python, PowerShell) to streamline security processes.

- Knowledge of cloud security practices and tools (e.g., AWS, Azure) is a plus.



QUALIFICATIONS

• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience.

• Experience: 3-5 years of experience in a SOC or cybersecurity role, with at least 1-2 years at a Level 2 position or equivalent.

• Certifications: Relevant certifications such as CompTIA Security+, CompTIA CySA+, or equivalent are preferred.



Preferred Qualifications

MSP background or experience managing security for multiple client environments.

Experience with vulnerability management and patch orchestration tools

LOCATION, SCHEDULE & COMPENSATION



This is a full-time remote role for candidates residing in the Philippines.  The schedule is Monday through Friday, 6am-3pm EST.  The salary is $2500/monthly.

title: Afterhours Engineer - NOC/SOC/Support
description:
Please apply for this job here: 



JOB SUMMARY

The Afterhours Engineer - NOC\SOC\Support is important in the Service Delivery division at CTS. Operating as the primary guardian of our clients' infrastructure during off-peak hours, this role combines Network Operations (NOC), Security Operations (SOC), and high-level VIP support.



Responsible for delivering impeccable maintenance, security monitoring, and "white-glove" support, this engineer must exhibit a sense of ownership over various systems. You will be responsible for triaging security alerts, executing i
 response playbooks, and ensuring VIP requests are resolved immediately, ensuring our clients’ environments are stable and secure before the morning shift arrives.



This is an individual contributor - technical position.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Service Delivery: Respond to and resolve service i
 following existing procedures and Service Level Agreements (SLAs). Track time, communications, and work output via ConnectWise Manage PSA.

Network Operations (NOC) Monitoring & Remediation: Remediate alerts from monitoring tools generated from firewalls, switches, access points, physical and virtual workstations, servers, and storage devices. Configure monitoring of client infrastructure using PRTG, Kaseya VSA, and ConnectWise Manage.

Security & I
 Response (SOC): Act as the first line of defense for security alerts. Triage potential threats (e.g., suspicious logins, EDR alerts, phishing reports) using established I
 Response playbooks. Isolate infected endpoints to prevent lateral movement and document forensic details.

VIP & Helpdesk Support: Provide primary "white-glove" remote support for VIP clients (CEOs/Executives) experiencing after-hours technical issues. Address all phone calls and urgent tickets outside of regular business hours with a focus on rapid resolution.

Cloud Administration: Administer and troubleshoot Microsoft 365 (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint) and Google Workspace environments to resolve urgent user access or configuration issues.

Maintenance & Automation: Administer and perform the work for monthly, quarterly, bi-annual, and yearly maintenance plans. Assist higher-level Engineers to automate recurring requests using Ninja RMM, ConnectWise Manage, PRTG, and PowerShell.

Backup Management: Monitor and remediate all CTS-provided client backup solutions: Acronis On-Prem, Acronis Cloud, and AFI.

Documentation: Create and maintain information and documentation in ConnectWise Manage and ITGlue to ensure a smooth handoff to the daytime engineering team.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

2+ years of experience in an MSP (Managed Service Provider) environment, specifically in a NOC or an L2/L3 escalation role.

Cybersecurity Fundamentals: Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles, threat landscapes (ransomware, phishing), and experience executing I
 Response playbooks.

Cloud Platforms: Advanced administration skills in Microsoft 365 (User management, Intune, MFA troubleshooting) and Google Workspace.

Networking: Experience with networking protocols: TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, VPN, IPSEC, VoIP, and QoS. Experience in WAN/LAN networking, including routing, switching, security, and load balancing.

OS Support: Experience with Microsoft Windows Server, Windows Desktop, and Apple Ecosystem.

WLAN & Hardware: Experience in WLAN technologies (Meraki, UniFi, Cisco) and Network Attached Storage (NAS).

VoIP: Experience with Grand Stream or other Asterisk-based PBX systems.

Soft Skills: Exceptional written and oral communication skills with the ability to de-escalate stressful situations for VIP clients.

Work Ethic: Self-motivated, with excellent time management skills and the ability to work independently without supervision during overnight hours.



PREFERRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

MSP experience.

Knowledge of scripting/programming language, including, but not limited to, PowerShell, BASH, and/or VBScript

Knowledge of network vendors: SonicWALL, Juniper MIST, Meraki, and Unifi

Knowledge of security tools: EDR/XDR,
 Filtering, Security Awareness, and Cloud Backups

Experience with MSP-related tools: ConnectWise Manage, Ninja RMM, PRTG, and ITGlue



WORK LOCATION & SCHEDULE

This is a full-time remote position for candidates located in the Philippines

The hours for this position are 6pm-6am EST, 4x/week including weekends (on a rotation basis)

COMPENSATION



The salary range for this role is $1600 - $2500/monthly



BENEFITS

Paid Time Off

Floating Holidays



This is an independent contractor role.

title: Cold Caller with Sales Experience
description:
Remote | Full-Time | Immediate Start

9:00 AM - 5:00 PM EST | Full-Time



We’re looking for confident, coachable people who can get on the phone and make things happen!

We're Tampa Diabetic Exchange, a fast-moving supplier of diabetic products to pharmacies across the US. We're expanding our cold calling team and we want hungry people who can grind, learn fast, and earn commissions.



What you’ll do:

- Make 150+ outbound calls per day (scripts and leads provided)

- Collect decision-maker info from independent pharmacies (names and
s)

- Set follow-ups and close accounts. You’ll learn how, we’ll train you

- Track your work and update our CRM daily



What you’ll get:

- Performance-based commissions and training allowance

- 13-day paid training program (2 days onboarding, 11 days live dials)

- Real earning potential if you hustle and close

- Opportunity to get hired full-time after training



What we’re looking for:

- Clear English speaker with strong phone confidence

- Fast learner who can take feedback and improve quickly

- Previous experience in cold calling, telesales, or healthcare sales

- Reliable internet, laptop with headset, and a quiet place to work

- Sales experience is a MUST.

title: Accountant Shopify and Financial Management
description:
Accountant Shopify and Financial Management



Employment type



Part time or full time



Location



Remote



About us



Sins ’n Lashes is a rapidly growing beauty brand with an international customer base. To manage our financial operations professionally, we are looking for an experienced accountant who is confident in traditional accounting practices and has strong technical expertise in integrating ecommerce systems.



Important note



We are not looking for agencies. This role is strictly for individual freelancers or solo professionals. Applications from agencies will not be considered.



Your responsibilities



• Full scope accounting for the entire company

• Preparation of balance sheets, profit and loss statements, and documentation for distributions

• Daily reconciliation and management of all incoming payments and accounts

• Accurate processing and allocation of transactions from Shopify, Airwallex, PayPal, and other payment providers

• Setup, maintenance, and optimization of integrations between Shopify and accounting software

• Regular review and reconciliation of outstanding items

• Creation of monthly and annual financial reports

• Ensuring compliance with all legal and tax documentation requirements

• Close collaboration with tax advisors, management, and financial partners

• Building scalable structures to support increasing transaction volumes



Your profile



• Several years of professional experience in accounting is required

• Strong understanding of Shopify’s financial structure and order system

• Experience integrating accounting software with Shopify such as Lexoffice, Sevdesk, Kontolino, or similar tools

• Deep knowledge of payment flows within Airwallex and PayPal

• German language skills are a plus, but relevant experience is more important

• Confident handling of balance sheets, P&L, accruals, liabilities, receivables, and depreciation

• Analytical mindset with high attention to detail

• Experience in ecommerce or digital business models

• Independent, structured, and reliable working style

• High sense of responsibility and discretion



What we offer



• Competitive compensation based on experience

• Flexible working hours part time or full time

• Modern working environment with flat hierarchies

• Long term collaboration with a fast growing beauty brand

• Opportunity to build scalable processes and actively shape workflows

• Close cooperation with management and the finance team



Please send us:

• Your CV

• A short overview of your accounting experience and expertise

• Proof of experience with Shopify, Airwallex, PayPal, and any accounting software you have used

title: Customer Service Manager
description:
Customer Service Manager



Job Description:

We are seeking a Customer Service Manager to lead our customer support team and ensure a seamless, high-quality experience for our customers. This role involves overseeing customer inquiries, troubleshooting processes, coaching tea
mbers, and collaborating across departments to maintain exceptional customer satisfaction.



Job Type: Full Time



Responsibilities:



-Team Leadership: Manage and mentor the customer service team to ensure consistent, professional, and high-quality support. Conduct regular performance reviews and provide coaching to drive improvement.

-Customer Support Oversight: Ensure timely and effective responses to customer inquiries across multiple platforms (calls,
s, text, messaging apps).

-Process Improvement: Identify recurring customer issues, develop solutions, and implement improved support processes.

-Product Knowledge Management: Maintain and update team knowledge on our product offerings, ensuring accurate and helpful guidance is provided to customers.

-Collaboration: Work closely with other departments (e.g., product, operations, marketing) to resolve complex customer issues and enhance overall customer experience.

-Reporting: Track customer service metrics, analyze performance, and present insights to senior management.

-Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date on product features, industry trends, and best practices to continually enhance team capabilities.



Requirements:



-Proven experience in customer service management or a related leadership role.

-Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

-Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.

title: Virtual Assistant - Full-Time
description:

We are looking for A-players who can think independently, make good judgment calls, and take full ownership of their work. If you are simply looking for “any job,” this role is not for you.



If you want long-term career growth with a fast-growing company expanding across Canada, keep reading.



About the Role



As an Operations Assistant, you will help run daily operations for a premium cleaning company in Montreal.



You will handle real situations — customer concerns, scheduling issues, and operational problems — and will be expected to solve problems calmly and independently, not follow scripts.



This role requires strong judgment, reliability, and comfort with responsibility.

- Handle customer issues and service concerns professionally

- Adjust schedules and resolve daily operational issues

- Communicate clearly with clients and cleaners

- Are reliable, disciplined, and consistent

- Are comfortable with technology and learning software

- Want long-term stability and growth



This Role Is NOT for You If:



- You need step-by-step instructions

Compensation & Schedule

- Full-time, consistent schedule aligned with Montreal hours

- Growth opportunities as the company expands across Canada



How to Apply

- Cover letter

- Resume

- Screenshot of computer specs

- Screenshot of internet speed

- Photo of your work from home set up

Generic applications may not be considered.

title: Experienced Real Estate Acquisition Sales Specialist
description:
Hourly + High Commission

We are hiring an experienced sales closer from the Philippines to join our U.S. real estate wholesaling company as an independent contractor.

If you are fluent in English, confident on the phone, and strong at negotiation, this is a high-income opportunity with weekly pay and unlimited commission potential.

________________________________________

** What You’ll Do

You will handle property acquisitions — speaking with homeowners, negotiating purchase prices below market value, and getting signed contracts.

Your main tasks:

•	Respond to inbound seller leads (PPC + website)

•	Qualify and negotiate with homeowners

•	Follow scripts and handle objections

•	Get signed agreements

•	Track all activity in our CRM

•	Make follow-up and cold calls when needed

Our team handles resale (disposition). You earn commission from the profit.

________________________________________

** Pay Structure

Training (First 2 Weeks)

•	$6/hour (paid training + Zoom sessions)

After Training

•	$8/hour base pay

•	PLUS commission based on deal profit

Commission Tiers (per month)

•	Deals 1–3 ? 20% of pure profit

•	Deals 4–6 ? 30%

•	Deals 7–9 ? 40%

•	Deals 10+ ? 50%

Pure profit = money remaining AFTER closing costs, fees, and expenses.

Example:

Deal profit $30,000

Expenses $20,000

Pure profit $10,000

20% commission = $2,000

* Hourly pay weekly

* Commission paid when deal funds are received

________________________________________

** Performance Expectations

•	Minimum 3 closed deals per month

•	Minimum $10,000 pure profit per deal

•	At least 10 work hours per week

•	Fast response to inbound leads

•	Cold calls only between 8am–7pm prospect local time

•	Typical commission payout timeline: 60–90 days after contract

________________________________________

* Requirements

•	5+ years sales experience

•	3+ years CRM experience

•	Excellent spoken and written English

•	Strong phone and negotiation skills

•	Familiar with real estate or home buying process

•	Reliable internet and professional setup

•	Able to follow scripts and coaching

________________________________________

* Schedule

Flexible hours, but must respond quickly to leads and attend required onboarding sessions.

________________________________________

** Growth

High performers earn higher commission tiers. No income cap.

________________________________________

** How to Apply

Send:

1.	Your sales experience

2.	CRM systems used

3.	Real estate experience (if any)

4.	Your weekly availability

5.	A voice recording (link only — no attachments)

6.	Subject line must include the word Closer

________________________________________

** Voice Recording (1–2 minutes)

Use Vocaroo, Google Drive, Dropbox, Loom, or similar.

Include:

•	Your name and location

•	Your sales background

•	Why you are a strong closer

•	A short pitch to a homeowner thinking about selling

Applications without a voice recording will not be reviewed.

________________________________________

Serious closers only. We are building a high-performance team.

title: DME Intake Operator

DME Virtual Intake Operator – Overview



A DME (Durable Medical Equipment) Virtual Intake Operator is responsible for efficiently handling incoming DME orders via phone, ensuring a seamless intake process from order to fulfillment.
