title: Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
Role Overview:

The Marketing Operations Specialist owns the systems that generate qualified leads for our marketing agency. This position is within our internal marketing team, generating leads for our own business, not for clients. This role sits between our top-of-funnel content engine (ads, social, YouTube, podcast) and our sales team, ensuring that traffic converts into sales-ready opportunities. The Marketing Operations Specialist builds and manages our HubSpot workflows, webinar funnels,
 campaigns, and case study library.



This is primarily an operational and technical role, not a creative one. You will build landing pages, automate follow-up sequences, maintain data hygiene, and ensure every lead is captured, nurtured, and routed to sales correctly. While the focus is on systems and execution, you should be comfortable handling minor creative tasks such as creating simple graphics or writing
s when needed.



Success in this role requires a balance of technical skill (HubSpot, automation tools, WordPress) and operational discipline (clean data, consistent execution, attention to detail). You should be comfortable working independently while collaborating closely with a small team to keep projects moving forward.



Core Responsibilities:

- Webinar Operations: Build and manage the complete webinar funnel, including landing pages (WordPress/Elementor), Zoom integration, HubSpot registration flows,
 sequences, and live event logistics. Coordinate promotional assets with the team to ensure timely execution.

- Marketing Automation: Architect HubSpot workflows for lead routing, scoring, and nurturing. Use automation tools (Zapier, n8n, or similar) to connect systems and automate complex tasks. Maintain pipeline hygiene, enforce data standards, and create sales enablement assets (templates, sequences, snippets).

-
 Marketing: Build and send weekly newsletters in HubSpot, manage the broadcast calendar, and optimize performance. Copy is often provided, but you should be able to write a clear, effective
 when needed.

- Social Proof and Case Studies: Interview successful clients, work with provided content and video to produce case study pages, publish on WordPress using Elementor, and package proof for the Sales team to use in conversations.

- Marketing Reporting and Dashboards: Build and maintain marketing dashboards that tie all activities together across the team. Provide clear visibility into performance across channels, campaigns, and initiatives to inform decision-making.

- Analytics and Reporting: Monitor performance using Google Analytics (GA4), Search Console, and HubSpot reporting to identify funnel gaps and recommend optimizations.



Requirements:

Must Have:

- 5+ years of hands-on HubSpot experience (building workflows, managing lists, setting up automations)

- Proficiency with WordPress and Elementor

- Experience with automation tools (Zapier, n8n, Make, or similar)

- Working knowledge of Google Analytics (GA4) and Search Console

- Strong data and reporting skills with the ability to build dashboards and synthesize insights

- Strong operational mindset with attention to detail and process enforcement

- Solid written communication skills

- Ability to create simple graphics and handle minor creative tasks



Nice to Have:

- Experience with n8n specifically

- Webinar funnel experience (Zoom)

- Agency or fast-paced startup background



What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days):

- HubSpot workflows are clean, lead routing works correctly, and sales reps trust the system

- Weekly newsletter goes out on time with improved performance metrics

- Webinar funnel runs smoothly from registration through reminders to follow-up

- Marketing dashboards are built and provide clear visibility into team performance



Schedule:

- Monday to Friday, 40 hours per week

- Must have at least 4-6 hours overlap with US Eastern Time (9am–5pm ET)

- Flexible schedule outside of core hours



How to Apply (Read Carefully):



To be considered, you MUST submit a screen-recording video (Loom, Vidyard, etc.).



Please record a 3–5 minute video that covers the following:



- Who you are and your experience with HubSpot.

- Share your screen and open up HubSpot (or a portfolio/screenshot of a past build).

- Walk us through a complex workflow or automation you built.

- Please explain the logic: What was the trigger? What was the goal? How did you handle branching or edge cases?

- Show us how you organized it.

- Why CGN: Briefly mention why you want to work with us specifically.



Our Hiring Process:



Application review

15-minute initial screening call

Video interview (45-60 minutes)

Practical skills assessment (HubSpot workflow build + troubleshooting)

Final interview

Reference check

Offer

title: Account Manager (Digital Marketing Company)
description:
***All applications must be submitted through this link ONLY:

hire.localvisibility.co/job-overview-account-manager

***Messages here in OnlineJobs.ph will not be considered.





Account Manager

Greetings from Local Visibility - your future workplace filled with positivity and endless possibilities! We are seeking talented account managers to join our dynamic team!



About Us:

Local Visibility is a growing digital marketing agency specializing in lead generation for home improvement and service companies in the US and Canada. We have been in business for 14 years and take pride in providing high-quality services.



Why Us:



Team harmony: Your wins are ours, and together, we create a harmonious work environment where your efforts and ideas truly shine.

Grow with us: Being with us means your journey is always exciting! Our goal is to give you the tools, help, and chances to move your career forward.

Everyone’s welcome: We’re happy to be in a place where each special voice isn’t just heard but really appreciated.

Celebrating YOU: Birthdays, small wins, or achievements - it’s important to celebrate the good things. We love acknowledging and appreciating each other.



Job Overview

The Account Manager is crucial for ensuring customer satisfaction and retention by fostering strong relationships, understanding client needs, and facilitating effective communication between clients and internal teams. As an account manager, you are responsible for managing the relationships with clients. They must speak English fluently without an accent. Additionally, the candidate must be presentable, as this is a client-facing role, and should have a strong background working with American clients.



The position includes:



Customer Relationship Management: Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients. Regularly communicate with clients to understand their needs, address concerns, and provide solutions.



Account Management: Understand the client's business objectives, industry challenges, and pain points to tailor solutions and offerings effectively.



Product Knowledge: Maintain a deep understanding of the company’s products and services.



Customer Feedback: Collect qualitative feedback from customers regarding their support experiences.



Responsibilities:

Create monthly marketing performance reports 
 Ads, Semrush, Bright Local, AdWords, Analytics).

Meet with clients at least once a month using Google Meet to review reports, progress, and plan future actions.

Responsible for handling incoming calls and providing support or assistance as needed.

Document customer service requests and follow through on open items for clients.

title: Student Financial Services Representative
description:
About Us:

CURE Advanced Aesthetics Institute is a premier aesthetics and beauty school dedicated to preparing students for successful careers through advanced training, hands-on experience, and industry-recognized certifications. Our commitment to excellence extends beyond the classroom, providing students with the financial literacy and resources they need to invest in their education and future.



We are seeking a professional, detail-oriented, and student-focused Financial Services Representative to guide students through the financial aspects of their education and support the Financial Department Manager with daily operations. This role requires excellent communication skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion.



?



Position Summary:



The Financial Services Representative will be responsible for conducting professional enrollment and financial interviews, assisting students with understanding their tuition options, supporting payment processing, and helping manage student financial records. This individual will work closely with the Financial Department Manager to ensure compliance with all state, federal, and accreditation requirements, while delivering outstanding customer service to students.



?



Key Responsibilities:



Student Financial Services

 • Conduct professional financial interviews with prospective and current students to explain tuition costs, payment plans, and financing options

 • Assist students with completing enrollment forms, payment agreements, and required documentation

 • Review financial aid and private financing options (if applicable) and explain requirements in clear, student-friendly terms

 • Ensure students understand their financial obligations, deadlines, and payment policies

 • Maintain accurate and organized student financial records in accordance with school policy and compliance standards



Enrollment Support

 • Conduct enrollment interviews with prospective students to review programs, schedules, and tuition details

 • Collaborate with the Admissions/Enrollment team to ensure a smooth transition from initial inquiry to enrollment

 • Follow up with prospective students to assist with decision-making and encourage timely enrollment



Financial Department Assistance

 • Support the Financial Department Manager with reporting, reconciliations, and recordkeeping

 • Assist in processing tuition payments, deposits, and refunds in compliance with policies

 • Monitor delinquent accounts and work with students to resolve payment issues professionally

 • Prepare financial reports and summaries as requested by the Financial Department Manager and Director



Compliance & Administrative Duties

 • Ensure all financial transactions and documentation comply with state licensing, accreditation, and institutional policies

 • Maintain confidentiality of all student and school financial data

 • Assist with audits and inspections by preparing and providing required documentation

 • Perform other related duties as assigned by management or the Director



?



Qualifications:

 • 2+ years of experience in financial services, student accounts, or administrative finance (education or vocational training industry preferred)

 • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional, polished demeanor

 • Strong customer service skills and ability to explain complex financial information in an understandable way

 • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and student information systems

 • High attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and recordkeeping

 • Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team

 • Knowledge of compliance requirements in education finance (preferred but not required)

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) - Agency & Internal Products
description:
Sales Development Representative (SDR) - Agency & Internal Products



**Company**: [Your Agency Name]

**Location**: Remote (Philippines)

**Employment Type**: Full-Time



## About Us



[Your Agency Name] is a dynamic, fast-growing agency dedicated to delivering exceptional results for our clients. We partner with a diverse range of businesses to launch and manage impactful sales and marketing campaigns. In addition to our client work, we are constantly innovating and launching our own suite of internal products. We thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for an energetic team player to grow with us.



## The Role



We are seeking a highly adaptable and results-driven Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our sales team. This is not a typical SDR role where you master one product and one pitch. You will be a key player in driving growth across multiple fronts, working on a variety of short-term client campaigns and our own internal product launches.



The ideal candidate is a master of context-switching, a quick learner, and a communication expert who is genuinely excited by the challenge of representing different brands and products. One week you might be booking demos for a client’s SaaS platform; the next, you could be generating leads for our new internal software. Your ability to quickly absorb new information, adapt your pitch, and maintain high performance across diverse campaigns is critical to success in this role.



## What You’ll Do



- **Master the Pivot**: Seamlessly switch between multiple client and internal campaigns, quickly learning new products, services, value propositions, and target audiences.

- **Multi-Channel Outreach**: Execute high-volume outbound prospecting for various campaigns through cold calling, personalized
 sequences, and LinkedIn outreach.

- **Lead Qualification & Booking**: Engage with potential customers to understand their needs, qualify them as sales opportunities, and book high-quality meetings for Account Executives.

- **Campaign Management**: Manage and report on the pipeline for several campaigns simultaneously, ensuring you meet or exceed targets for each.

- **Client-Facing Communication**: Represent client brands with the utmost professionalism, providing a best-in-class first impression.

- **Internal Collaboration**: Work closely with our internal product and marketing teams to develop and refine outreach strategies for our own products.

- **CRM Discipline**: Meticulously track all activities, update lead statuses, and manage data with high accuracy across our CRM (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce).

- **Feedback Loop**: Provide valuable feedback from the front lines to help our clients and internal teams refine their messaging and product strategies.



## You’re a Fit If You…



- **Thrive on Variety**: You are bored by monotony and energized by the challenge of learning and pitching new things constantly.

- **Are a Quick Study**: You can rapidly understand new business models, technical products, and buyer personas and translate them into compelling outreach.

- **Have Flawless Communication Skills**: You possess perfect, C2-level English (both written and verbal) and can articulate value propositions clearly and concisely.

- **Are a Master of Organization**: You can juggle multiple projects, pipelines, and priorities without letting anything slip through the cracks.

- **Are Resilient & Coachable**: You view objections as opportunities, take feedback in stride, and are always looking for ways to improve your craft.

- **Are a Proactive Problem-Solver**: You don’t wait for instructions; you take initiative to find answers and drive results.



## Requirements



- 2+ years of proven success in a B2B Sales Development or Inside Sales role.

- Demonstrable experience with high-volume cold calling and
 outreach.

- Perfect (C2) written and verbal English communication skills.

- Proficiency with modern CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and sales engagement tools (e.g., Outreach, Salesloft, 
).

- A quiet, professional home office setup with a reliable, high-speed internet connection.

- Must be comfortable being on camera for internal meetings and potential client-facing interactions.



## Bonus Points



- Experience working in a marketing or sales agency environment.

- Experience with a wide range of industries (e.g., SaaS, E-commerce, Professional Services).

- Familiarity with cold
 platforms (e.g., Instantly.ai, Smartlead).

title: Senior Python Automation Developer (Microsoft Environment) – Part-time, Immediate Start
description:
About Us

Tres Civil is an engineering, project management and data analytics company (Australia  
). Our clients run on Microsoft business systems (SharePoint / Office 365 / Power BI). We build solutions that produce real outputs fast, and we care about clean, reliable delivery.



**The Role (Python-first)**

We’re looking for a highly experienced Python developer to build automations for:

Pulling data from portals and websites (authenticated where required)

Turning that data into professional PDF outputs and reporting-ready datasets

Integrating neatly into Microsoft workflows (Excel/SharePoint/Power BI triggers)



Strong English (written + spoken) is mandatory. You must be able to communicate clearly, document your work, and work independently.



Immediate Gig (Start ASAP): Portal URL ? PDF Packs

We have a portal where each inventory item has a unique URL (we provide access). We need an automated workflow that:

-Takes a list of URLs

-Produces individual PDFs and/or bundled PDF packs

-Includes title page + headers/footers (page numbers, date, title, etc.)

-Delivers output to a folder and/or via

-Has sensible logging + error handling (summary of successes/failures)

Python is the primary skill that gets this done.



Ongoing Work After This Gig

If the first gig goes well, there is ongoing part-time work including:

-Python data collection for market research and business growth (web + YouTube, using official APIs where possible)

-Building repeatable scraping/collection scripts with rate limiting, resilience, and clean outputs

-Data cleaning + structuring for reporting (CSV/Excel/SQL/SharePoint/Dataverse as needed)

-Automation workflows that integrate with Microsoft tools (Excel/SharePoint/Power BI triggers)



Must-Have

-Advanced Python (automation, web extraction, parsing, reliability patterns)

Comfortable with authenticated web portals (sessions/cookies/tokens; browser automation if needed)

-Able to generate/merge PDFs and control formatting (title pages, headers/footers)

Strong engineering habits: clean code, documentation, error handling, logging

-Very strong English (spoken and written)



Nice-to-Have

-Power Automate / Power Platform, Power BI familiarity

-Azure Functions / lightweight APIs (for triggering runs from Microsoft tools)



How to Apply

Please include:

Python overview: the most complex automation you’ve built (what it did, stack, scale, reliability approach)



-Approach: in 5–10 bullet points, how you would build the portal URL ? PDF automation described above

-Availability this week (hours + timezone)

-Hourly rate

-Confirm you can start immediately for the first gig

Screening Questions (answer in your application)

-In bullets, how would you build the portal URL ? PDF automation (auth + headers/footers + bundling)?

-What Python tools would you use (e.g., Playwright/Selenium + PDF library) and why?

-How do you handle failures at scale (retries/logging/summary)?

What’s your method for bundling PDFs and producing a final “pack” cleanly?

title: AI Short-Form Video Producer (Part-Time with Full-Time Opportunity)
description:
We are hiring a **part-time** AI Video Producer to create short-form vertical videos using text-to-video AI tools. This role is execution-only: you focus on turning our ideas into finished videos, not on strategy or script writing.



You will be given:

- Clear concepts  

- Hook lines / opening copy  

- Mood and format requirements  



Your job is to turn these into clean, consistent, high-quality AI videos ready for YouTube Shorts, TikTok, and Reels.



???? 90-DAY TRIAL PERIOD WITH FULL-TIME OPPORTUNITY  

This is a part-time position starting with a 90-day trial period (approximately 20 hours per week). During this trial, we will evaluate quality, reliability, communication, and ability to follow instructions. Strong performers will have the opportunity to transition to a full-time position with our content team.



???? RESPONSIBILITIES  

- Create 15–60 second vertical videos (9:16) using AI text-to-video tools  

- Expand provided concepts into strong video prompts  

- Generate and refine AI outputs for clarity, pacing, and visual quality  

- Do light editing if needed (timing, trims, basic sound)  

- Deliver platform-ready MP4 files on a consistent schedule  



???? REQUIRED EXPERIENCE  

- **Proven experience** using AI text-to-video tools such as:

  - Runway, Kling, Higgsfield, Sora, Veo, Midjourney, or similar tools

  - (You don't need ALL of these—experience with ANY AI video generation tool is acceptable as long as you can produce quality results)

- Strong prompt writing ability for video generation  

- Understanding of:

  - Visual pacing  

  - Camera motion  

  - Mood and tone consistency  

- Ability to follow instructions and deliver without close supervision  



???? REQUIRED TO APPLY (MUST INCLUDE ALL)  

Applications missing ANY of the following will be ignored:  

- 3 AI-generated videos you personally created (short-form preferred)  

- One full prompt you actually used to generate a video  

- A short list of AI video tools you actively use  

(Important: No stock footage. No templates. AI work only.)  



???? NOT REQUIRED  

- No degrees or certifications  

- No influencer experience  

- No hook writing (hooks will be provided)  

- No voice-over or on-camera work  



???? BONUS (NOT REQUIRED)  

- Experience creating Shorts, Reels, or TikToks  

- Ability to maintain visual consistency across multiple videos  

- Experience working with Google Docs, Notion, or Trello  



???? PAY & HOURS  

- Part-time position (approximately 20 hours per week during 90-day trial).

- Output-based pay with competitive rates based on experience and performance.

- Opportunity to transition to full-time after successful completion of 90-day trial period.



???? HOW TO APPLY  

Reply with:  

- Your AI video portfolio (links)  

- The AI tools you use  

- One video prompt you personally wrote  



We are looking for someone who treats AI video creation as a craft, not a gimmick, and who wants to grow with us long-term.

title: Virtual Business Manager / Virtual Executive Assistant
description:
WORK TYPE: Part-time contractor (remote), 90-day pilot term

SCHEDULE: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–2:00 PM ET

START: February 23, 2026

END OF PILOT TERM: May 23, 2026 (with potential extension based on performance and funding)

PAY: $8.00 USD/hour



ABOUT BRIDGEWELL TRUST

BridgeWell Trust is a membership-based workforce and business exchange that connects small businesses (“Builders”) with vetted workforce members (“BridgeCrew”) for clearly scoped, dignified, paid gigs. We build the trust layer that makes this work: structured onboarding, vetting coordination, documentation standards, communication protocols, and quality assurance so the system is safe, repeatable, and measurable.



ROLE SUMMARY

We are hiring a Virtual Program & HR Operations Coordinator to help build and operate BridgeWell’s 90-day pilot foundation. This role is primarily HR operations and program administration. You will coordinate onboarding, vetting workflows, member records, member communications, and internal documentation. Grant writing may occur, but it will be led by BridgeWell leadership; this role supports coordination, formatting, and documentation.



This position will interface frequently with business members (“Builders”), workforce members (“BridgeCrew”), and program partners. The ideal candidate is organized, discreet, calm, and able to build systems that are easy to follow.



REPORTING

You will report to:

 • Zainab Kamarah (Program Lead)

You will collaborate with:

 • Vanessa Womack (Board Chair) and other designated leaders/partners



KEY OUTCOMES (FIRST 60–90 DAYS)

 1. Establish a repeatable onboarding workflow for both Builders and BridgeCrew (intake, checklists, orientation scheduling, documentation).

 2. Implement a member tracking system (recommended tool + workflow) that allows leadership to see status at a glance.

 3. Create core HR/process documentation: SOPs, templates, scripts, and a consistent communication cadence.

 4. Stand up a vetting coordination workflow (background checks, fingerprinting, and drug testing coordination pathway), including vendor research and a recommended process for leadership approval.

 5. Maintain high-quality program administration: timely inbox responses, clean records, and clear escalation notes.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

HR Operations and Member Management

 • Manage onboarding for two member types (businesses and workforce members): intake forms, checklist completion, orientation scheduling, and documentation follow-up.

 • Coordinate vetting steps and track completion status (background checks, fingerprinting, drug testing coordination), maintaining confidentiality and access controls.

 • Maintain accurate member records, including contact info, onboarding status, vetting status, and participation logs.

 • Support HR-style issue documentation: capture concerns, track follow-ups, and escalate to leadership with clear written summaries.



Program Operations and Administration

 • Create and maintain core program documents (policies, SOPs, onboarding packets, templates, member-facing instructions, agreements).

 • Support gig workflow administration: ensure gig templates are complete, scope is clearly defined, key documents are in place, and close-out steps are documented.

 • Maintain the program calendar and task tracker; attend weekly operations meetings and produce meeting notes + action items.

 • Support dispute-resolution administration by organizing documentation and timelines (leadership makes decisions; you maintain the record).





Systems and Tooling (Important)

 • Recommend and implement a simple, secure system for tracking members and program activity.

 • Preferred: Airtable or similar database tool; acceptable: Google Sheets + shared drive structure.

 • Create a basic internal dashboard for leadership: member pipeline, vetting completion, active gigs, and exceptions/escalations.



Vendor/Process Research (Pilot Phase)

 • Research and propose practical options for background checks, fingerprinting, and drug testing coordination appropriate for the Richmond, VA area.

 • Draft a recommended workflow and vendor comparison for leadership decision-making.

 • Note: you will coordinate; you will not be required to be onsite.



Communications and Relationship Support

 • Monitor and manage the program inbox (and any assigned accounts), ensuring professional and timely responses.

 • Communicate with Builders and BridgeCrew regarding next steps, missing documents, scheduling, and expectations.

 • Maintain outreach templates and program update messaging (leadership-approved messaging).



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

 • 3+ years experience in HR coordination, recruiting coordination, program operations, nonprofit operations, or executive/operations support.

 • Strong English writing and editing, especially for SOPs, policies, onboarding instructions, and professional
s.

 • High attention to detail; comfortable handling sensitive/confidential information.

 • Ability to follow and build SOPs, meet deadlines, and track work cleanly.

 • Professional communication skills; able to work with diverse populations respectfully and consistently.

 • Strong spreadsheet skills (tracking, logs, status boards).



REQUIRED TOOLS/SKILLS

 • Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Calendar)

 • Excel/Google Sheets proficiency

 • Comfort learning new systems quickly

 • Basic document formatting (professional PDF output, templates)



PREFERRED (NOT REQUIRED)

 • HR/people-ops experience (onboarding, HR documentation, HR inbox management)

 • Experience supporting workforce programs or community-based initiatives

 • Familiarity with background check coordination workflows

 • Airtable (or similar database) experience

 • Project management or quality assurance training/certifications



CONFIDENTIALITY AND SECURITY REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

 • Must sign NDA and IP/confidentiality agreements.

 • Must use 2-factor authentication and follow access-control rules.

 • Must be able to work securely with sensitive records (no public/shared devices; no unauthorized file sharing).

title: Customer Experience Associate – Fashion E-commerce (Remote)
description:
About ARDANT:

ARDANT is a fast-growing jewelry brand redefining what everyday luxury feels like. We create bold minimalist jewelry for ambitious, style-conscious women who want to feel confident and unstoppable.

Our customers are primarily based in the US, Australia, Canada, and the EU, and they expect a premium, warm, and emotionally intelligent experience at every touchpoint.

We’re known for customer service that feels like your chic, thoughtful best friend. The one who always shows up for you. If you’ve supported women in the fashion or jewelry space and genuinely care about helping people feel seen and supported, we’d love to meet you.



What You’ll Be Doing:

You’ll be the first line of human connection with our customers, resolving issues, creating brand love, and making every interaction feel like luxury.

• Handle support tickets in Commslayer with empathy, clarity, and ARDANT’s signature voice

 • Use ChatGPT (we’ll train you) to draft thoughtful, brand-aligned replies that:

• Solve problems

• Protect profitability

• Increase customer satisfaction and lifetime value

 • Manage orders, refunds, returns, exchanges, and shipping issues in Shopify

 • Understand nuances across regions (US, AU, CA, UK, EU) and tailor responses accordingly

 • Tag patterns, escalate high-value cases, and support product and marketing feedback loops

 • Suggest relevant upsells or cross-sells when appropriate

 • Turn negative experiences into 5-star stories customers want to tell their friends about



Who You Are:

• Experienced or teachable: You have customer support experience for an online e-commerce or dropshipping store (at least 1 year), and you are easy to train and eager to improve

 • Customer-focused: You’ve supported customers in markets like the US, AU, CA, or the UK

 • Emotionally intelligent: You know when to reassure, when to solve, and when to simply listen

 • Detail-oriented: Typos, inconsistencies, and loose ends genuinely bother you

 • Organized and reliable: You follow SOPs and also know when to use good judgment

 • Tech-savvy: You’ve used Commslayer or Gorgias and Shopify, or you can learn very fast. Familiarity with ChatGPT is a plus

 • Voice-driven: Your writing sounds human, warm, and polished, never stiff, robotic, or overly casual

 • Bonus: You’ve worked with a premium or luxury brand with a strong, consistent tone of voice



Tools You’ll Use:

• Commslayer (customer service platform)

 • Shopify (orders, refunds, and returns)

 • ChatGPT (using ARDANT’s custom prompt templates)

 • 3PL internal system

 • Google Workspace, Slack, Notion, and our 3PL portal



Why ARDANT:

• Work with a female-led, values-driven brand that genuinely cares

 • Receive direct mentorship from the founder to help you grow

 • Help shape a global community of ambitious, stylish women

 • Long-term growth opportunities for tea
mbers who consistently go the extra mile



To Apply:

Please send an
 with the following:



1. A short introduction answering:

What fashion, jewelry, or e-commerce brands you’ve supported

Your experience as a customer support agent (including dropshipping or online stores)

Which markets you’ve worked with (US, AU, CA, EU)

Your availability (timezone and hours per week)



2. Your updated resume



3. A sample response to this customer message

 (Hint: please read our return policy before answering)

“Hi, I just received my order and I want to make a return after I realised the earrings do not fit my ears.”



4. A short written answer to this question:

What is your understanding of a last mile tracking number, and why is it important for customer support?



 Subject Line:

 CS Application – [Your Full Name] – Favorite Ardant Piece



As a company, we invest heavily in our people. We are only looking for hungry, motivated, and long-term tea
mbers. If you believe great support is an art and you are excited to help build a brand that makes women feel unstoppable, we can’t wait to meet you.

title: Project & Operations Lead
description:
Project & Operations Lead 

 

*** Please include your resume with the number 1900 as the subject header, along with outlining your relevant experience and qualifications to be considered for an interview. *** 

 



We’re looking for a highly organized, proactive, and strategic Project & Operations Lead to join our team. If you excel at bringing structure to complexity, driving successful project outcomes, and ensuring smooth daily operations, this role is for you. 



 



About the Role 



As the Project & Operations Lead, you’ll be responsible for overseeing both project execution and organizational operations. You’ll collaborate closely with leadership, internal teams, clients, and partners to deliver high-impact results, streamline processes, and support the company’s strategic growth. 



This role requires a strong balance of planning + execution, leadership + collaboration, and strategy + hands-on action. 



 

Key Responsibilities 



A. Project Management 



-Planning & Execution: Develop and implement detailed project plans—including timelines, budgets, resources, and quality standards. 

-Stakeholder Coordination: Work with teams, clients, and partners to clarify project goals and keep alignment throughout the project lifecycle. 

-Progress Monitoring: Track milestones, monitor performance, and ensure projects stay on schedule and on budget. 

-Risk & Issue Management: Identify risks early, develop mitigation plans, and address issues proactively. 

-Reporting & Documentation: Maintain clear project documentation and provide regular updates to stakeholders and leadership. 

-Post-Project Review: Conduct project evaluations to assess outcomes and identify improvements for future workflows. 



 



B. Operations Management 



-Daily Operations Oversight: Manage daily operational workflows and ensure seamless interdepartmental coordination. 

-Process Optimization: Analyze and refine processes for greater efficiency, scalability, and customer satisfaction. 

-Team Leadership: Support and coordinate with cross-functional teams, promoting accountability and performance. 

-Budget & Resource Management: Assist with cost control, financial planning, and resource allocation. 

-Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure compliance with policies, regulations, and organizational standards. 

-Vendor & Partner Coordination: Maintain productive relationships with vendors to support reliable operations. 

-Performance Measurement: Track operational metrics and generate insights to support strategic decision-making. 



 



What You Bring 



-Strong experience in project management, operations, or business execution 

-Ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously 

-Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills 

-A mindset focused on structure, process, and continuous improvement 

-Ability to work collaboratively with both internal teams and executives 



 



Why Join Us? 



-You’ll play a key role in shaping operational excellence and driving successful outcomes across the organization. This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives in fast-moving environments and enjoys bringing clarity, efficiency, and strategy to the table. 

 

*** Important: Please include 1900 in the subject line of your
 and outline your relevant experience and qualifications to be considered for an interview.***

title: Social Media Manager
description:
Working Hours: 9:00 AM to 7:00 PM HKT (Monday to Friday) including 1-hour lunch break and 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM HKT (Saturday)



JOB SUMMARY



We are looking for a resourceful and self-motivated Social Media Manager who thrives in a fast-paced, environment. This role goes beyond content scheduling — it demands someone who is deeply invested in the company’s mission, willing to take initiative, and ready to contribute wherever the business needs them most.



You will own and drive our social media strategy while also having the opportunity to contribute to high-impact projects across departments. We are seeking a team player who understands that in a startup, dedication often comes before reward — and who is prepared to grow with the business by taking risks, solving problems, and delivering results.



RESPONSIBILITIES



•Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy to increase brand awareness, engagement, and conversions.

•Manage and oversee the company's social media accounts, including but not limited to
,
, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest, and YouTube.

•Create, publish, and optimize engaging and high-quality content in line with our brand identity and target audience.

•Monitor and analyze social media performance using analytics tools, and provide regular reports on key performance indicators (KPIs).

•Collaborate with internal teams, such as marketing, sales, and customer service, to align social media efforts with company goals.

•Respond to comments, messages, and inquiries on social media platforms, fostering a strong community and positive brand reputation.

•Stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends, tools, and best practices to ensure effective and innovative strategies.

•Evaluate the company's social media and digital marketing plans, see areas for development, and provide strategic advice.

•Analyzing the company’s digital marketing plan and social media strategy and identifying strategic weaknesses and making recommendations for improvements.

•Research social media trends and update management on any changes that are relevant to the business's marketing initiatives.

•Develop and manage social media advertising campaigns, including audience targeting, budget allocation, and performance tracking.

•Perform data analysis to see whether social media marketing objectives have been attained.

•Coordinate with influencers and industry professionals for partnerships, collaborations, and content creation.

•Provide training and guidance to tea
mbers on social media best practices and content development.



QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS



•Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a Social Media Manager or similar role

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Bookkeeper

Working Hours: 9:00 AM to 7:00 PM HKT (Monday to Friday) including 1-hour lunch break and 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM HKT (Saturday)



JOB SUMMARY



We are seeking a highly skilled and organized Bookkeeper with strong hands-on experience with Xero to manage our financial records and ensure accurate bookkeeping practices. The Bookkeeper will work as a Contractor and play a key role in maintaining financial transactions, reconciling accounts, preparing financial statements, and assisting in financial reporting. This position requires strong attention to detail, proficiency in Xero, and the ability to work independently.



With a high level of attention to detail and a focus on delivering accurate work on time, you should be able to transform a conversation into high-quality documents and instructions.



RESPONSIBILITIES



• Financial Data Management:

o Record day-to-day financial transactions, including accounts receivable, accounts payable, and general ledger entries.

o Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records, ensuring proper classification and coding of transactions.

o Track and manage petty cash to ensure accurate recording of small expenditures.

o Categorize and allocate expenses to the appropriate accounts.

o Perform bank reconciliations and ensure the accuracy of financial data entries.

o Track financial transactions by building up accounts, completing the posting process, and ensuring compliance with legal requirements.



• Financial Reporting and Analysis:

o Prepare and analyze monthly Profit and Loss (P&L) statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.

o Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.

o Provide insights into financial performance to support decision-making processes.



• Payroll and Benefits Administration:

o Process payroll, ensuring accurate calculations of salaries, deductions, and benefits.

o Maintain employee payroll records.

o Coordinate with HR to ensure compliance with payroll regulations and timely submission of required reports.



• Compliance:

o Assist in the preparation of financial data for audits, ensuring compliance with relevant accounting standards and regulations.

o Collaborate with external auditors, providing necessary documentation and support during the auditing process.

o Ensure alignment with tax laws, reporting requirements, and tax filing deadlines.

o Stay updated on changes in accounting standards and regulations to ensure ongoing compliance.



• Inventory and Purchase Order Management:

o Monitor incoming, outgoing, and shipped products.

o Coordinate with the supply chain department to track inventory levels, purchase orders, and reconcile received goods.

o Collaborate with the supply chain team to resolve any discrepancies or issues related to inventory or purchase orders.



• Financial Systems and Process Improvement:

o Set up bookkeeping policies and procedures.

o Help lessen control risk in the inventory process by suggesting policies.

o Identify opportunities for process improvement in financial systems and procedures, recommending and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and accuracy.



QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS



• Minimum three (3) years of relevant experience in Bookkeeping or Accounting roles.

• Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

• Strong hands-on experience with Xero software is a must.

• Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, and bookkeeping practices.

• Experience in integrations (e.g., DEXT) is a plus.

• Experience with inventory management systems such as Cin7 or similar systems is a big plus.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a high attention to detail.

• Strong organizational and time management skills.

• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

• Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.



Essential Requirements for Remote Work:

• Reliable Laptop or Desktop Computer.

• Stable and high-speed internet connection.

• Power source and backup internet connection in case of electricity interruptions.



***How to Apply***



Take the next step by completing our application form:


/
/f/3j1fc-35945/HQ578HNFWTW3B7LXDL



Note: Only successful candidates will be contacted for the next phase of the selection process. We appreciate your time and interest in joining our team.

title: Sales Development Representitive
description:
Sales Development Representative (Cold Calling)



Molecular Biology Products Inc. (MBP)

Remote | Full-Time or Part-Time

Pay will be Base + Commission



Molecular Biology Products Inc. (MBP) is a growing North American supplier of molecular biology reagents and lab consumables serving academic, biotech, and pharmaceutical laboratories. We help research teams reduce cost per reaction through strategic sourcing and high-quality alternatives to major brands.



We are seeking a confident, energetic Sales Development Representative (SDR) whose primary role is outbound cold calling to research labs and procurement teams across North America.



Role Overview



This role is focused on generating qualified meetings for our sales team through high-volume outbound calling. You will introduce MBP to lab managers, procurement officers, and scientists, positioning our cost-saving solutions and securing discovery meetings.



If you are comfortable on the phone, resilient to rejection, and motivated by targets, this role offers strong growth potential in scientific sales.



Key Responsibilities



Conduct high-volume outbound cold calls to academic and biotech laboratories



Introduce MBP’s value proposition and cost-saving sourcing solutions



Identify lab decision-makers (lab managers, procurement, PIs)



Qualify opportunities and schedule meetings for Account Executives



Maintain accurate CRM records of calls and outcomes



Follow call scripts and continuously refine messaging



Meet or exceed weekly call and meeting targets



Ideal Candidate



Confident, clear, and professional speaking voice



Comfortable making 60–120+ cold calls per day



Strong persistence and resilience to rejection



Excellent English communication skills



Organized and target-driven



Prior SDR, telemarketing, or cold-calling experience preferred



B2B or scientific/medical sales exposure is a plus



Compensation



Base pay (hourly or salary depending on experience)



Performance bonuses per qualified meeting



Growth path into Account Executive role



Why Join MBP



Sell into cutting-edge biotech and research labs



Clear value proposition (cost savings + quality alternatives)



Fast-growing scientific supplier



Direct mentorship from leadership



Opportunity to grow into scientific sales



Application Instructions



To apply, please send:



Resume



A short 1–2 minute video introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for a cold-calling SDR role



 applications to: 



Subject line: SDR Application – [Your Name]

title: Finance Manager E-Commerce Brand
description:
We are a fast-growing, performance-driven e-commerce brand looking for an experienced Finance Manager who understands the dynamics of high-volume online businesses.



This is not a theoretical role. We are looking for someone hands-on, analytical, and process-oriented who can build financial clarity and structure at scale.



Key Responsibilities

1. Supplier & Invoice Control



Review and verify all supplier invoices (COGS, shipping, surcharges, custom fees)



Ensure pricing agreements are correctly applied



Identify discrepancies and proactively resolve issues



Maintain structured invoice tracking and approval systems



2. Returns & Exchange Loss Analysis



Create a monthly overview of financial losses from:



Returns



Exchanges



Refunds



Payment processing fees



Identify patterns and financial leakage



Provide actionable recommendations to reduce loss rates



3. Daily Profit & Loss Reporting



Build and maintain daily P&L sheets



Track:



Revenue by payment provider



Ad spend



COGS



Refunds



Payment fees



Gross & net profit



Ensure full transparency of daily cash flow and margins



4. Process Optimization



Set up and improve financial workflows



Build structured reporting systems



Implement controls to prevent financial errors



Work closely with operations, customer support, and marketing



Requirements



Proven experience in e-commerce finance (mandatory)



Strong understanding of:



COGS structures



Payment providers (PayPal, Klarna, Airwallex, etc.)



Refund and dispute impact on margins



Performance marketing cost structures



Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills



Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail



Hands-on mentality – you don’t just report problems, you solve them



Ability to build and improve financial processes independently



What We’re Looking For



We need someone experienced, structured, and proactive.

Mistakes cost money in our business — precision and ownership are essential.



You should be comfortable operating in a fast-moving, high-revenue environment and be able to create clarity in complex financial flows.



If you are detail-oriented, experienced in e-commerce finance, and ready to take ownership of financial transparency and process optimization, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Full-Stack Developer for AI-Powered SaaS Platform (Pharma Industry)
description:
???? ABOUT PIXEL PHARMA

We are building an AI-powered document intelligence platform for the pharmaceutical validation industry. Our MVP is already structured and coded in Lovable (backed on GitHub), but we need an experienced developer to complete the backend, database architecture, security features, and AI integration.



We are a Swiss-based startup (Visp, Valais) with strong market validation from industry leaders like Lonza. This is a contract-to-hire opportunity with potential for long-term collaboration as we scale.



???? WHAT YOU'LL BUILD

Complete the MVP of our retrieval-first AI platform that helps pharmaceutical engineers search, retrieve, and draft validation documents (protocols, SOPs, etc.).



WHAT'S ALREADY DONE:

? Frontend UI (built in Lovable)

? Basic project structure (GitHub repository)

? Website design and branding

? Product roadmap and specifications



WHAT YOU NEED TO BUILD:

1. Database Architecture

   - Design and implement a scalable database schema (PostgreSQL or similar)

   - Handle document storage, versioning, and metadata

   - User management and permissions system



2. Backend API

   - Build RESTful API endpoints (Node.js/Express or Python/FastAPI)

   - Authentication and authorization (JWT, OAuth)

   - File upload and processing pipelines



3. Security Features

   - Implement role-based access control (RBAC)

   - Data encryption (at rest and in transit)

   - Compliance with basic security standards (GDPR-ready)



4. AI Integration (RAG System)

   - Integrate AI models for document retrieval (OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source LLMs)

   - Build a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline

   - Implement semantic search using vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, or ChromaDB)

   - Train/fine-tune models to retrieve relevant information from uploaded documents



5. Integration & Deployment

   - Connect frontend (Lovable) with backend

   - Deploy to cloud (AWS, Google Cloud, or Vercel/Railway)

   - Set up CI/CD pipeline (GitHub Actions)



? REQUIRED SKILLS:

- 5+ years of full-stack development experience

- Strong expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript (Node.js, React)

- Experience with database design (PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB)

- Experience building RESTful APIs and backend architecture

- Knowledge of authentication/authorization systems (JWT, OAuth)

- Experience with AI/ML integration (OpenAI API, LangChain, or similar)

- Understanding of RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems

- Experience with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, ChromaDB, or FAISS)

- Familiarity with cloud deployment (AWS, GCP, Azure, or Vercel)

- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently



???? NICE TO HAVE:

- Experience with 
v or similar low-code platforms

- Knowledge of pharmaceutical/healthcare industry or regulated environments

- Experience with document processing (OCR, PDF parsing, NLP)

- Familiarity with Python (for AI/ML workflows)

- DevOps skills (Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD)



???? DELIVERABLES:

Phase 1 (Weeks 1-4): Database schema, Backend API with authentication, Basic RAG pipeline

Phase 2 (Weeks 5-8): Advanced AI features, Security hardening, Frontend-backend integration

Phase 3 (Weeks 9-12): Production deployment, Performance optimization, Documentation



???? COMPENSATION:

- Salary: $1,500 - $3,000 USD/month (based on experience)

- Contract Type: Fixed-term (2-3 months) with potential for full-time hire

- Equity Opportunity: Possible equity grant for long-term contributors

- Flexible Hours: Work on your own schedule



???? WHY JOIN PIXEL PHARMA?

? Early-stage opportunity with strong market validation (Lonza endorsement)

? Impactful work solving real problems in a $15B+ industry

? Direct collaboration with experienced founders

? Equity potential for long-term contributors

? Flexible remote work from anywhere



???? TO APPLY:

Please submit:

1. Your Resume/CV and Portfolio (GitHub, live projects)

2. Brief cover letter answering:

   - Why are you a good fit for this role?

   - Have you built RAG systems or AI-powered applications before? (Share examples)

   - What is your experience with database design and backend architecture?

3. Your expected monthly rate (in USD)

4. Availability: When can you start? How many hours per week?



Let's build the future of pharmaceutical validation together! ????

title: CRM & Member Engagement Coordinator
description:

This is an operational and relationship-driven role that supports the Editor/Owner by bringing structure, accountability, and responsiveness to the business.

* Maintain a clean, organized system so no conversations are lost.

* Set reminders and follow-up sequences.

* Improve CRM organization and reporting.

* Ensure all leads and members are properly categorized and tracked.

3. Editorial Coordination & Guide Updates

* Track content revisions and deadlines.

* Coordinate with members to collect updated information.

* Support editorial calendar and publication timelines.

* Ensure guides remain current and accurate.

- Success Metric: Guides are consistently updated without last-minute scrambling.



Nice to Have (Not Primary Responsibilities at This Time)

* Coordinate with a bookkeeper or accounting system.

2. Social Media Support

* Support content coordination.



Ideal Candidate Profile:

* Highly organized and detail-oriented.

* Strong communicator (written + verbal).

* Proactive and system-minded.

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Role Purpose



To lead and secure the company’s financial operations by ensuring accurate financial visibility, cash flow control, and forward-looking financial planning, while protecting the business through transaction analysis, reconciliations, fraud detection, and high-quality reporting.



Key Responsibilities

1. Financial Strategy & Planning



Define, build, and manage the annual budget



Develop rolling forecasts (monthly / quarterly)



Analyze variances between actuals vs forecasts



Support strategic decision-making (growth, pricing, hiring, investments)



2. Cash Flow & Treasury Management



Build and maintain cash flow forecasts



Monitor daily and weekly cash positions



Optimize working capital (BFR)



Anticipate cash constraints and propose corrective actions



Manage relationships with banks and financial partners



3. Financial Transaction Analysis



Analyze all incoming and outgoing financial transactions



Monitor payments to/from customers, suppliers, and service providers



Identify anomalies, inconsistencies, or suspicious transactions



Implement transaction control rules and monitoring processes



4. Reconciliations & Financial Controls



Perform and supervise bank reconciliations



Reconcile invoices, payments, and collections



Review accounting entries in coordination with external accountants



Strengthen and secure financial processes and internal controls



5. Fraud Detection & Risk Management



Identify and assess fraud risks



Design and implement internal control procedures



Ensure proper segregation of duties



Audit sensitive financial flows (payments, refunds, cards, subscriptions)



6. Financial Reporting & KPIs



Produce clear, accurate, and decision-oriented financial reports



Track and analyze key financial KPIs, including:



Cash runway

title: Social Media Content Editor (Execution Role)
description:
We’re hiring a Social Media Content Editor to execute a clearly defined content plan for a high-end fashion-led brand.

This is not a strategy or ideation role.



All content direction, voice guidelines, raw assets, brand colours, templates, and posting structure are provided.

Your job is to take provided materials and turn them into clean, polished, on-brand social posts — consistently and efficiently.



Core Responsibilities

Content Production (Execution-Focused)

Using provided assets (scripts, raw video, podcast clips, images, written notes), you will:

• Edit short-form Reels (15–60 seconds)

• Design structured carousels using existing layout rules

• Create minimal static posts using brand templates

• Draft captions using the provided voice guide

• Repurpose one core idea into multiple formats following our documented structure

This role requires precision and consistency — not reinvention.



Reviews

• Pull Google reviews on a set schedule

• Convert reviews into on-brand static and motion posts using existing formats

• Draft captions aligned with the voice guide

Podcast Clips

• Select strong 
nts from provided podcast timestamps

• Edit into short-form clips

• Add clean, readable subtitles using brand font rules

• Apply consistent cover formatting



Brand Standards

You must:

• Follow the brand style guide exactly

• Use provided fonts, colours, and layout rules

• Keep typography clean and minimal

• Avoid over-designed, “template-heavy” aesthetics

• Maintain consistent spacing, pacing, and formatting

title: AI Automation Expert Needed
description:
We are looking for a practical, hands-on AI Automation & Co-Pilot to help us build an internal team assistant bot and a variety of automation workflows.



This is a highly technical role. You’ll act as a Technical Co-Pilot, owning the heavy lifting: writing and debugging code, managing deployments on Vercel, and ensuring our AI-powered systems run smoothly. You’ll take early concepts, experiments, and rough prototypes and turn them into stable, production-ready solutions.



You’ll work closely with the CEO and internal team—no client-facing work required.



What You Will Do:

- Develop & Deploy: Build backend logic for AI agents and deploy them using Vercel (Serverless functions).

- AI Integration: Connect our tools to LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) via API to process text and data.

- Code Review & Fixes: Work with the CEO to troubleshoot their code, fix bugs, and optimize logic.

- AI Coding: Use AI coding tools (Cursor, Copilot, etc.) effectively to speed up development. We care about results, not writing every line from scratch.

- Automation: Build workflows to connect different APIs and internal data sources.



Requirements:

- Strong JavaScript / Node.js: You must be comfortable writing and debugging backend logic.

- Vercel Experience: You know how to set up projects, manage environment variables, and deploy.

- API Proficiency: You have hands-on experience with working with REST APIs.

Experience with AI Models: You have worked with OpenAI API or similar. You understand prompts, tokens, and temperature.

- Problem Solver: You don't just write code; you figure out why something isn't working and fix it quickly.



Nice to Have:

- Experience with Google Apps Script (useful for internal tool integrations).

- Experience with OpenAI(or equivalent) APIs.

- Knowledge of automation platforms like n8n or Zapier.



Who You Are:

- A Doer: You prefer building things over talking about theory.

- Patient & Collaborative: You are happy to jump on a call, look at someone else's broken code, and fix it while explaining the solution.

- Fast: You know how to leverage AI tools to write code 10x faster than the average developer.



APPLY HERE: 



Please DO NOT apply if you DO NOT HAVE EXPERIENCE. Thank you!

title: Accountant - Remote (PH)
description:
Our finance team plays a central role in the business, ensuring leadership has clear, accurate financial information to guide strategic decisions.

We’re looking for a detail-oriented accounting professional who takes pride in maintaining clean books, building structured processes, and delivering consistent, dependable work. This role owns core accounting operations and is responsible for maintaining accuracy and discipline across recurring monthly cycles.

You’ll work directly with leadership and operate with a high level of autonomy. Success in this role requires strong judgment, follow-through, and comfort managing both day-to-day accounting and critical monthly deliverables in a fast-moving but well-structured environment.

What You’ll Own



Day-to-day accounting operations across multiple entities

Timely and accurate month-end close processes

Account reconciliations and financial reporting

Payroll processing (Gusto)

Commission calculations tied to assets under management

Maintaining organized and reliable financial data

Preparing account summaries and supporting leadership reporting

What We’re Looking For



2+ years of experience as an Accountant or Senior Accountant

Experience with QuickBooks and Gusto

Strong Excel proficiency, including working within shared spreadsheets

Experience in wealth management, financial planning, or financial services

Prior experience working for a U.S.-based financial company

Experience calculating commissions and performing reconciliations

Strong understanding of accounting principles, financial reporting, and compliance (GAAP/IFRS, tax, audits)

Experience preparing account summaries

Familiarity with tax reduction strategies is a plus

CPA preferred, but not required

Willing and able to complete a background check requiring fingerprinting

How You Work



Comfortable navigating shared file systems and cloud-based environments

Confident working directly in shared documents without relying on local downloads

Quick learner who adapts easily to new systems and processes

Proactive communicator, comfortable engaging directly with leadership (Slack-based communication)

Confident asking questions and seeking clarification

Reliable, analytical, and highly detail-oriented

title: Case Manager - Personal Injury (Bilingual English/Spanish)
description:
Here for the Case Manager:



About the Role

We’re looking for an experienced Bilingual Case Manager (English/Spanish) with at least 2 years of hands-on experience in a Personal Injury law firm. This role is ideal for someone who understands the full lifecycle of PI cases and takes pride in keeping everything organized, moving forward, and on track.

You’ll play a key role in guiding cases from intake to resolution—maintaining clear communication, coordinating with attorneys and providers, and ensuring every detail is handled accurately and on time. The right person is proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable managing multiple cases in a fast-paced legal environment.



Core Responsibilities



Act as the primary point of contact between injured parties, attorneys, medical providers, and insurance companies.

Open and manage new Personal Injury cases, ensuring proper intake and documentation.

Maintain organized and accurate case files, including medical records, billing statements, and correspondence.

Monitor treatment progress and follow up with providers to obtain records, reports, and invoices.

Support attorneys with case preparation, including drafting correspondence, organizing discovery, and tracking timelines.

Manage calendars, deadlines, hearings, depositions, and mediations.

Prepare settlement demands and assist with medical lien negotiations.

Provide consistent, professional communication throughout the life of each case.





What We’re Looking For



2+ years of experience as a Case Manager in a Personal Injury law firm.

Strong understanding of PI workflows, including medical record requests, demand drafting, lien negotiations, and litigation support.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (Spanish proficiency is a plus).

High attention to detail with strong organizational and time management skills.

Experience using case management software such as Clio, Filevine, Needles, or similar platforms.

Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and adapt in a fast-paced legal setting.





Nice to Have



Experience handling California cases and familiarity with local court procedures.

Knowledge of medical billing and lien resolution processes.

Previous experience working remotely with U.S.-based law firms

title: Real Estate Data Research VA
description:
Please review this job post completely before applying.



Job Title: Real Estate Research & Data Analyst (Virtual Assistant)

Type: Full-Time, Long-Term

Hours: 40 hrs/week (EST)

Location: Remote

Start Date: Immediate (within 7 days)



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company actively acquiring off-market properties. We are looking for a Data Research Specialist to support our acquisitions team by cleaning, organizing, and preparing property data.



This is not a cold calling, marketing, or underwriting role. You will be working with data only — following instructions to identify qualified leads, maintain clean records, and provide accurate updates inside our systems.



If you’re detail-oriented, comfortable with large datasets, and confident in Excel and CRM work, this is a great long-term role for you.



What You’ll Do



? Organize and clean property records inside our CRM (REISift)

? Review and filter property data based on criteria we provide

? Upload/download lists from sources such as Zillow, PropStream, PropWire, and MLS (Jacksonville, FL)

? Use Excel/Google Sheets to clean and format bulk data sets

? Convert property reports from PDF to Excel using Tabula

? Flag qualified leads for the acquisitions team according to instructions

? Maintain accurate, consistent records and prepare weekly summaries of work completed



Must-Have Skills



? 2+ years working in real estate data research, list management, or related role

? Strong working knowledge of Zillow, MLS, REISift, PropStream, and PropWire

? Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (downloading, uploading, cleaning datasets, using formulas)

? Experience with PDF-to-Excel conversion tools (Tabula or similar)

? Detail-oriented and consistent — accuracy in data cleaning is critical

? Reliable computer and high-speed internet setup for daily full-time work

? Good written English for reporting and notes



Bonus Points



? Experience supporting U.S. real estate investment teams

? Familiarity with skip tracing workflows

? CRM experience (REISift preferred)

? Ability to handle large data sets without errors



Why Work With Us



? Stable, long-term role with consistent hours

? Professional U.S. real estate investment team

? Opportunity to grow into higher-level roles as the company expands

title: Horror Stories Video-Editor Needed ! :)
description:
I am looking for a talented Video Editor to help me create faceless YouTube videos in the niche of horror and true Reddit stories. I am a big fan of channels like Mr. Nightmare, and I want my videos to have a similar vibe and quality.



For reference: 



Please watch some of his videos to understand what I'm searching for.



Project Details:



· Content: Horror storytelling (True Horror, Reddit Stories, Creepy Pastas).

· Audio: The Voiceover is already finished. You will not need to record anything, just edit the visuals around it.

· Visual Style: Dark, immersive, and fitting for the horror genre.



What I am looking for in the edit:



1. Background Footage: Sourcing and editing fitting B-roll/scenes that match the narrative (dark forests, abandoned houses, creepy POV shots, relevant stock footage).

2. Sound Design: Adding background ambiance and sound effects (SFX) that match the story. For example, if the Voiceover mentions a door creaking or footsteps, I would love to hear those sounds subtly in the background.

3. Background Music: Implementing eerie, suspenseful, or atmospheric background music that builds tension throughout the story.

4. Captions/Subtitles: Ideally, dynamic captions that highlight key words to keep viewers engaged.



Requirements:



· you have access to video editing softwares, and a steady Internet connection

· your English skills are conversational

· You should have experience editing storytelling or horror videos - or at least see yourself getting into it.

· You have a good sense of pacing to keep the viewer hooked.

· You have access to stock footage websites or your own library of assets.

 

What I provide:



· I will provide the finished Voiceovers

· I am ready to pay 35$ per finished video (editing style is easy) & I'm looking to get 5 - 10 videos finished per month. So your monthly salary could be up to 350$ for easy work.

· if I see you're reliable and do excellent work I am positive to raise that salary 



I'm looking forward to work with you :) 

Kind regards ~ Oliver

title: HR & Finance Specialist
description:
Job Description

This is a remote position.



About Growing Being

At Growing Being, we help step into their fullest, most authentic selves—supporting them to heal, grow, and thrive in love, leadership, and life. Through coaching programs, personal development tools, and a growing global community, we empower people to live with purpose, alignment, and deep self-worth.



We're expanding and looking for a values-aligned HR and Finance Specialist to join our mission-led team. If you're passionate about systems, people, and making meaningful work work better—you might be exactly who we're looking for.



The Role

This is a dual-role position responsible for managing HR processes and supporting the financial health of the company. You’ll help maintain a supportive, well-structured team culture while ensuring financial accuracy and compliance.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities



HR:

Manage recruitment, onboarding, and contracts

Maintain employee records and HR compliance

Support performance reviews and team wellbeing

Create/update HR policies



Finance:

Track expenses, income, and budget reporting

Process payroll and contractor payments

Maintain bookkeeping

Coordinate with our accountant for reporting and compliance



What You Bring

2 years’ experience in HR, finance, or operations

Strong organization, communication, and integrity

Aligned with our mission to empower people



Benefits

Why Work With Us

Purpose-driven and flexible work culture

Remote-first team with heart

Room to grow and shape company systems

Meaningful, impact-led work



TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE CLICK HERE: zurl.to/6oya?source=CareerSite



For more information
:

title: Amazon & eBay Order Processing Assistant (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a remote assistant whose main responsibility is ordering products on Amazon that we have sold on eBay.



You will receive access to our eBay and Amazon accounts. Your primary task is to open new eBay orders, copy customer and product details, and place the corresponding orders on Amazon using our provided accounts and order sheet.



After processing all orders, you will also handle basic eBay customer support by replying to customer messages in German using translation tools.



Work should be done within 13:00–05:00 Philippine time (covering business hours in Germany).



Current workload: approximately 2–3 hours per day, processing around 100 orders daily across two shops.

 to feel natural and genuine. Forget the stiff cover letter vibes, impress us by showing off your real personality, the same way you’d charm a new affiliate partner.



Key Responsibilities:

• Manage the day-to-day operations of Cabana’s affiliate program

• Recruit, onboard, and support new affiliate partners

• Set up tracking links, monitor conversions, and manage payouts

 (preferred), Rakuten, Commission Junction, Partnerize etc.

• Strong communication, negotiation, and organizational skills

• Data-driven mindset and comfort working with reports

• Independent, resourceful, and proactive

• Friendly and high energy



Why work with Cabana:

• Work from anywhere you feel most inspired

• Enjoy a flexible schedule, with just a few overlapping US business hours for collaboration

• See your impact come alive as part of a fast-growing US wellness brand

• Do work that’s purposeful, stylish, and fun - because wellness should feel good for us too!



Role Overview:

You’ll own the management and growth of Cabana’s affiliate program, from onboarding partners to tracking performance and ensuring timely payouts. The ideal candidate has experience with networks like 
, Rakuten, Commission Junction, Partnerize etc. This is a strategic and hands-on role, ideal for someone who thrives on relationship management and data-driven growth.



About Cabana:

Cabana is where science meets style, a modern luxury wellness brand redefining what it means to look and feel your best. We offer science-backed treatments like GLP-1s and hormone therapies, helping people live with more confidence, energy, and ease.

description:
Before anything else…



We can definitely tell when a message feels overly dependent on or fully generated by AI. Nothing wrong with using AI (we all do!), but if you really want to stand out, we’d love to hear your voice. Your taste. Your thinking. Your creative energy.



!! How to Apply (Read Carefully) !!

Incomplete applications won’t be reviewed. If you’re applying for a Creative Director role, attention to detail and the ability to follow direction is kind of the bare minimum.



1. Use “Creative Director” as your
 subject line.

2. In your message, include: A short introduction about yourself

3. A link to your resume and portfolio

4. Your availability to start

5. Your desired starting rate ($/hour)



JOB TITLE: Creative Director



Key Responsibilities:

- Lead the creative direction and execution of Cabana’s visual identity across all platforms

- Drive the design of products, packaging, campaigns, website visuals, and digital content

- Collaborate cross-functionally to tell one cohesive brand story

- Review, refine, and elevate all creative output to ensure luxury-level consistency

- Translate strategy into stunning visuals that capture the heart of our audience

- Inspire and guide the design team while staying hands-on when needed



Bonus: Step in as Brand Designer for key campaigns or special projects



Qualifications:

- 2–3+ years of experience in art direction, brand design, or creative leadership

- Strong portfolio showcasing visual identity work across digital and print

- Mastery of design systems, typography, color, and composition

- Experience in lifestyle, luxury, or wellness brands

- Detail-oriented, collaborative, and obsessed with visual storytelling

- Strong project management skills — able to run projects end-to-end and keep timelines tight



Bonus:

- Good sense for copywriting (you think visually and verbally)

- Proficiency in Figma, Framer, or similar tools



Why Work with Cabana?

- Work from anywhere that sparks your creativity

- Flexible schedule (just a few shared US hours for collaboration)

- Paid Philippine holidays

- Supportive, no-drama team

- Build a luxury wellness brand that blends science with style



Role Overview:

At Cabana, design isn’t just how we look, it’s who we are.



As our Creative Director, you’ll shape and elevate Cabana’s visual world across every touchpoint — from our website and campaigns to packaging and branded experiences. This role is about bringing beauty, intention, and storytelling into every pixel.



You’ll collaborate closely with our Brand Designer, Front-End, and Web teams to bring our luxury wellness vision to life. Every detail should feel thoughtful, modern, and unmistakably Cabana.



Perfect for someone who lives for aesthetics, thrives on creative energy, and knows how to turn a brand into a feeling.





About Cabana:

Cabana is where science meets style, a modern luxury wellness brand redefining what it means to look and feel your best. We offer science-backed treatments like GLP-1s and hormone therapies, helping people live with more confidence, energy, and ease.



We’re building something beautiful. At Cabana, you won’t just design visuals, you’ll help shape a world where wellness feels elevated, effortless, and deeply personal.
