title: Shopify E-commerce Operator (Founder’s Right Hand)
description:
We are building a fast-growing U.S. e-commerce brand and we are looking for a serious, experienced Shopify operator to become the founder’s right hand. You need to be a REAL LEADER and problem solver. 



This is NOT a beginner VA position.

This is for someone who has actually managed and operated Shopify stores.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for day-to-day operations inside our Shopify ecosystem, including:



- Product listings (variants, metafields, mockups, descriptions)

- Printify product setup + syncing

- Order management & fulfillment checks

- Customer support handling 
 based)

- Refunds / returns / tracking issues

- App setup & optimization

- Basic theme edits (sections, layout adjustments)

- Uploading ad creatives & organizing assets

- Supplier communication when needed

- Helping improve systems & processes



You must think in systems, not tasks.



This Job Is For You If: (Min. 3+ years experience as virtual assistant)



- You have managed multiple Shopify stores 

- You understand fulfillment flows end-to-end

- You have worked with Printify or POD before (Preferred, or willing to learn quickly)

- You can troubleshoot Shopify issues independently

- You are extremely organized and detail-oriented

- You don’t wait for instructions — you take ownership

- You know how to hire and build a team

- You are calm under pressure

- You are a quick learner and a real leader



Do NOT Apply If:

- You’ve only “assisted” but never operated a store

- You need constant supervision

- You disappear or go offline during work hours

- You are managing 3–4 other full-time clients



Work Requirements



- 48 hours per week

- Flexible schedule, but you must be consistently online and reachable

- Fast response time is critical

- Long-term position only



Compensation



$1,000 USD per month starting



Growth to $1,500 USD per month based on performance



Long-term opportunity with growth into operations leadership



Application Instructions (Important)



To apply, answer the following:



Tell us about all your skills and experience as a shopify e-commerce brand operator



What is your motivation and why are you a real A player



List the Shopify stores you have directly managed (not assisted). What was your exact responsibility?



Explain how Printify fulfillment works step-by-step.



Confirm you are available at least 48 hours per week and not working full-time for another client.



Start your application with the word: OPERATOR



Applications without these answers will be ignored.

title: Google Workspace Expert
description:
We’re Hiring a Google Workspace Expert!



We are seeking a technically strong Google Workspace Expert to lead a structured migration, configuration, and security hardening of our Google Workspace environment.



We are not looking for basic setup support — we’re looking for someone who understands infrastructure,
 authentication, and scalable Workspace architecture.



This role is project-based and remote, with a defined scope and clear deliverables.



About Us



Best Life is a fast-growing e-commerce company specializing in ergonomic sleep and comfort products. Our operations rely heavily on
 reliability, structured Drive access, and secure user management. We are optimizing our internal systems to support long-term scalability and international operations.



What You’ll Do & What We’re Looking For



Job Responsibilities and Tasks:



- Plan and execute a structured Google Workspace migration (users, mailboxes, domains, aliases, shared inboxes,).

- Configure Gmail, Drive, Admin Console, Groups, and Organizational Units properly.

- Set up and validate domain authentication (MX, SPF, DKIM, DMARC).

- Implement security best practices (2FA enforcement, role-based admin access, permission structuring).

- Integrate Workspace with third-party tools and automate workflows where possible.

- Configure and support Gemini and AI-driven workflows within Workspace.

- Provide documentation and basic SOPs so our team can operate confidently.

- Ensure the Workspace environment is stable, secure, and ready for scaling.



Skills and Qualifications:



- Proven experience with Google Workspace migrations and configuration.

- Strong understanding of DNS, MX, SPF, DKIM, and domain verification.

- Experience working with hosting providers (e.g., Vimexx or similar).

- Experience with Gemini for Google Workspace and implementing AI-assisted workflows, including automation, documentation systems, and
 process optimization.

- Ability to explain technical topics clearly to non-technical tea
mbers.

- Proactive problem-solver who takes ownership and works independently.



Salary:



- Open to proposal - the project can be priced in phases (1: setup & migration, 2: SOPs & optimization, 3: Gemini and custom GPT training), with a clear rate and timeline per phase.



Screening Questions: To be considered, please answer the following clearly and specifically.  Please note that generic responses will not be considered. Kindly answer based on real implementation experience and include supporting screenshots or proof of past work (sensitive information may be blurred).



1. Describe a recent Google Workspace migration you completed.

    - Company size?

    - Migration complexity?

    - What challenges did you face and how did you solve them?

2. Have you worked with DNS providers like Vimexx, GoDaddy, Cloudflare, or similar?

    - Which ones?

    - Describe a propagation or DNS conflict issue you resolved.

3. What would your structured migration plan look like for a 10-15 user company?  Outline your phases briefly.

4. Have you implemented Gemini or AI tools within Google Workspace?

    - Describe a real workflow you built.

    - What problem did it solve?

title: WordPress Content & Operations VA — Health/Wellness Website (Long-Term, Part-Time)
description:
## About The Project



I run a research-based health website focused on kidney disease and anti-aging interventions — 
. The site is built around a published book covering 68 scientifically-validated natural therapies, supported by a blog with articles grounded in medical research (PubMed, nephrology journals, etc.).

I'm a full-time professional based in Sydney, Australia, with limited availability. I need someone who can own the operational side of this website completely — not someone who waits for instructions on every small task.

This is a long-term role. If you're good and the site grows (which is the plan), your hours and pay grow with it.



What You'll Be Doing

In the first 30 days, your priorities will be:



Installing and configuring WordPress plugins (Google Analytics 4 via Site Kit, Search Console, RankMath SEO, ConvertKit, Pretty Links, Hotjar, UpdraftPlus)

Setting up
 opt-in forms and a welcome
 sequence in ConvertKit/MailerLite

Auditing all existing blog articles against a Google EEAT compliance checklist I'll provide

Revising articles using Claude AI (I'll give you a prompt template) to improve citations, author authority signals, and trustworthiness markers

Setting up affiliate links for health supplements (iHerb, Amazon Associates) using Pretty Links



After the first month, your ongoing responsibilities will include:



Publishing 2-3 SEO-optimised blog articles per week (you research and write drafts; I review and approve)

Building and managing a monthly keyword content calendar using Ubersuggest or similar

Managing
 broadcasts and the monthly community newsletter draft

Monitoring GA4 and Search Console and sending me a brief weekly summary (what's ranking, what's growing, what needs attention)

Maintaining affiliate link accuracy and adding new affiliate opportunities as they arise

Light Canva work for blog images and product mockups





You're The Right Person If:



You have at least 2 years of hands-on WordPress experience (not just "I've used it" — you know plugins, themes, settings, and can troubleshoot basic issues without Googling for 3 hours)

You have done SEO content work before and understand what keyword research, meta descriptions, and internal linking actually mean in practice

You're comfortable using AI tools like Claude or ChatGPT to assist with content drafting and revision — you don't need to be an expert, but you can't be afraid of it

You have worked on a health, wellness, or medical-adjacent website before (not required, but a significant advantage)

You can work with minimal supervision — I'll give you clear deliverables and deadlines, but I won't micromanage daily tasks

You're based in the Philippines and available for a short weekly check-in call (30 min, Sydney time — flexible on exact timing)

Your written English is excellent. Health content requires precision — vague or sloppy writing won't work here





You're NOT The Right Person If:



You need constant hand-holding or daily check-ins to stay on track

You've never managed affiliate links or worked with monetised content before

You apply to every job on this platform without reading the post (see application instructions below)

You're looking for short-term or project-only work



Hours & Compensation



Start: 20 hours/week

Rate: $5 USD/hour depending on experience (open to negotiation for the right candidate)

Paid weekly via Wise or Payoneer

Hours can increase to 30-40/week within 3-6 months as the project scales



Tools You'll Be Using

WordPress, RankMath, ConvertKit or MailerLite, Pretty Links, Google Analytics 4, Google Search Console, Ubersuggest, Canva, Claude AI, Gumroad, Google Docs/Sheets, Notion (for task tracking)



How To Apply

To filter serious applicants: begin your application message with the phrase "Kidney Health VA" followed by your answer to this question:

"Describe one specific thing you would check or fix on a health blog article to improve its Google EEAT score. Be specific — not general."

Then include:



A brief overview of your most relevant experience (2-3 paragraphs)

Links to any WordPress sites you've worked on (even if you just managed them — I'm not looking for designers)

Your availability and timezone

Your motivation (or story) for the role



Applications that don't follow these instructions will not be read. This isn't being harsh — it's how I know you pay attention to detail, which is the most important quality for this role.



One More Thing

This website is about a topic that matters — helping people with serious kidney disease find affordable, evidence-based options outside the standard clinical pathway. I want someone who finds that work meaningful, not just someone filling hours. If that resonates with you, I'd love to hear from you. If anyone of your family or friends is suffering from chronic diseases, and if you are going deep into clinical research to help him or her, include that in the "Your motivation (or story) for the role" section.



NOTE: Applications must be handwritten — AI-generated responses will be filtered out. The role itself heavily involves AI tools including Claude, so comfort with AI is required

title: International Export Sales Manager (Food & Agricultural Products)
description:
We are looking for an experienced International Export Sales Manager to handle end-to-end export of coconut oil and other coconut-based products. This role covers local supplier management in the Philippines and international sales activities focused on Europe and Israel.



You will manage sourcing, export operations, and business to business (B2B) sales while building long-term relationships with suppliers and international clients.

- Hands-on experience with export logistics and documentation

- Strong understanding of Incoterms, shipping, and international trade processes

- Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken)

- Strong negotiation, pricing, and deal-closing skills

- Ability to manage multiple suppliers and clients across different time zones

- Detail-oriented, independent, and execution-focused



Responsibilities

- Source, onboard, and manage local coconut product suppliers and manufacturers

- Negotiate pricing, volumes, MOQs, contracts, and delivery schedules

- Coordinate production planning, lead times, and product availability

- Monitor product quality, specifications, and consistency

- Manage export documentation including invoices, packing lists, certificates, and related requirements

- Coordinate with freight forwarders, shipping partners, and customs brokers

- Ensure compliance with EU and Israeli food import regulations and labeling standards

- Develop and execute business to business (B2B) sales strategies for Europe and Israel

- Build and maintain a strong pipeline of importers, distributors, and manufacturers

- Conduct client meetings, sales negotiations, and contract discussions

- Track market trends, pricing, and competitive landscape

- Prepare sales forecasts and basic commercial performance reports



Plus to Have

- Experience with coconut products or tropical agricultural commodities

- Familiarity with EU food compliance or Israeli import requirements

- Knowledge of organic, non-GMO, or similar product certifications

- Existing buyer or distributor network in Europe or Israel

- Experience working with export companies or export-focused SMEs

title: Video Editor for Paid Ads (Meta, TikTok, UGC, D2C Brand)
description:
About Us

Ace & Taylor is a fast-growing D2C e-commerce brand selling premium hair tools across Europe. We focus on high-performing direct response video ads for Meta 
/Instagram) and TikTok.



We work with a creative engine: every week our creators produce raw content, and we test multiple variations to find winners. We are currently active in The Netherlands and Belgium and expanding across Europe.



What You’ll Do (Your Core Responsibility)

You will be our dedicated Video Editor for performance ads. Your job is to turn raw creator content into multiple high-converting ad variations for Meta & TikTok on a weekly basis.



This is NOT basic video editing.

We are looking for someone who understands direct response marketing and knows how to edit videos that convert.



Your Weekly Tasks

- Edit 5–15 short-form ad videos per week (UGC + lifestyle + product demos)

- Create multiple variations from the same raw footage (different hooks, captions, pacing, first 3 seconds, CTAs)

- Add subtitles optimized for TikTok & Meta (fast, bold, attention-grabbing)

- Cut for retention: strong hooks in the first 1–3 seconds

- Follow our creative briefs, examples, and SOP

- Deliver on time every week

- Implement feedback and iterate on winning creatives

- Organize files properly (naming, folders, versions)



We Are Looking For Someone Who

- Has experience editing direct response / performance ads

- Understands how ads work on Meta & TikTok (hooks, pacing, scroll-stopping edits)

- Is detail-oriented and follows instructions carefully

- Is proactive: asks questions if something is unclear

- Can work independently once the SOP is clear

- Can handle weekly production without reminders



Important

We work fast and test a lot of creatives.

If you:

- Miss deadlines

- Don’t follow instructions

- Don’t ask questions when confused

- Or deliver inconsistent quality



This will clearly not be a fit.



Paid Test Task (Mandatory)

Before we hire you, we will ask you to complete a small paid test assignment (1–2 short ad videos) based on real raw footage and a clear briefing.

This helps both sides see if we’re a good match.



Long-Term Opportunity

If this works well, this can become a long-term collaboration with consistent weekly work, growth in responsibility, and higher pay over time.

title: Patient Care Coordinator
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Remote Patient Services Representative based in the Philippines. The ideal candidate will manage inbound and outbound calls, assist patients with scheduling appointments, address inquiries, and perform other related tasks to ensure a seamless patient experience.



Key Responsibilities:

• Answer incoming calls promptly and professionally.

• Schedule, reschedule, and confirm patient appointments using our electronic health record (EHR) system.

• Provide accurate information regarding services, insurance, and payment options.

• Address patient inquiries and concerns with empathy and efficiency.

• Maintain and update patient records with a high degree of accuracy.

• Collaborate with the optometry team to ensure optimal patient care.



Performance Metrics:

To ensure excellence in patient service, the following performance metrics will be used to evaluate success in this role:

• Average Handle Time (AHT): The average duration of a patient interaction, including talk time, hold time, and after-call work. Efficiently managing AHT ensures timely assistance to patients while maintaining service quality. ?

• Quality Score: Assessment of call quality based on adherence to protocols, accuracy of information provided, and overall patient interaction effectiveness. High-quality scores reflect a commitment to excellence in patient care.

• Patient Satisfaction Score: A measure of patient contentment with the service provided, often gathered through post-interaction surveys. High scores indicate successful patient engagement and issue resolution.

• Service Level: The percentage of calls answered within a specified timeframe, reflecting the ability to meet patient demand promptly. Maintaining a high service level ensures patient satisfaction and loyalty. ?

• Appointment Scheduling Rate: The efficiency and accuracy in scheduling patient appointments, ensuring optimal utilization of clinic time and resources.



Qualifications:

• Proven experience in a customer service role, preferably in a medical or optometry setting.

• Exceptional verbal and written English communication skills.

• Familiarity with EHR systems and medical scheduling software is a plus.

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

• Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.

• Stable internet connection and a quiet workspace conducive to professional phone conversations.



Work Schedule:

• Full-time position.

• Must be available to work U.S. business hours, including potential evening shifts to accommodate different time zones.



To Qualify, please complete the Assessment below:



1. Application form: wkf.ms/45nfpCJ

2. Complete this assessment: 
/link/index/JB-BYUGHNDRC?u=

title: Canva / Photoshop Designer for Etsy Stores (Short-Term Project)
description:
I’m looking for a highly skilled Canva / Photoshop designer and Etsy specialist for a short-term, intensive project.



This is NOT a full-time job.

This is a focused project that must be completed within approximately 3 days.



PROJECT DETAILS:



You will receive one main folder containing around 650 subfolders.

Each subfolder represents a different lighter model and includes multiple images from different angles.



PHASE 1 – Sorting & Categorization

* Organize all products by main colors (silver, gold, black, etc.)

* Create subcategories within each color (engraved, 3D, patterns, finishes, special designs)

* Build a clean, logical, and well-structured catalog



PHASE 2 – Store Distribution

* Distribute the products into 10 different Etsy stores

* Each store should contain around 65 products

* No duplicate products between stores

* Each store must have a balanced mix of colors

* Stores must not look identical



PHASE 3 – Store Identity & Design

* Each store must have its own unique visual style

* Consistent design language within each store

* Clear visual separation between stores



PHASE 4 – Images & Visual Consistency (VERY IMPORTANT)

* Design and optimize the main product image for each store

* Main images must match the store’s style and branding

* All secondary images must also follow the same visual line



PHASE 5 – Branding

* Apply the correct logo and banner for each store

* Add a small logo in the top-left corner of product images

* All visuals must align with the store’s branding



REQUIREMENTS:

* Strong Canva skills (Photoshop is a big advantage)

* Proven experience with Etsy stores

* High attention to detail

* Ability to work fast and independently

* Immediate availability for an intensive 3-day project



This project has a clear deadline.

Excellent performance may lead to additional projects in the future.

description:

We are currently building up our social media presence and are looking for a dedicated Social Media Manager who can drive community growth while maintaining a high-quality visual standard.



Your Responsibilities:

- AI Affinity: You know how to use Google Gemini or ChatGPT to bridge language barriers and generate creative concepts.

Reliability: You must be available and online within the working hours (8:00 AM – 11:45 AM PHT).

.

title: Contract Admin
description:
The Role



As a Contract Administrator, you will hold a key position in our project team. You will be responsible for the end-to-end administration of contracts, ensuring financial accuracy through variation management and progress claims, and providing critical support to our Project Managers and Estimators.



Key Responsibilities



**Review, interpret, and administer head contracts, subcontracts, and supplier agreements.

**Manage variations, monthly progress claims, payment schedules, and three-way match purchase order processing.

**Work closely with Project Managers on cost tracking, forecasting, and the preparation of variation submissions.

**Track contract milestones and deliverables while maintaining accurate records of all contractual correspondence.

**Assist the Estimating team with tendering and bid submissions to support future growth.



Skills & Experience



**Proven background in contract administration roles, ideally within the HVAC or mechanical services industry.

**Competent in using modern software and apps with a high level of attention to detail.

**A strong team player with excellent communication skills.

**Ability to multitask and manage conflicting priorities in a fast-paced project environment.



Why Join Us?



**As part of a growing organisation, you will have opportunities to learn, grow, and develop new skills in a supportive environment.

**This is a dynamic and varied role, so you won’t ever be bored. Every day will bring new challenges and opportunities to learn.

**This is a great opportunity for someone seeking a challenging yet rewarding position with a growing company.

title: Automation & Data Pipeline Engineer
description:
Core Platform Experience

- n8n (strong hands-on experience)

- Zapier / Make.com (nice to have)

- Workflow debugging in node-based automation tools

- Handling binary data inside automation environments

- Managing large batch executions (hundreds/thousands of items)



HTTP & Networking

- Deep understanding of HTTP methods (GET, POST)

- Response types: text, JSON, file/binary

- Headers and content negotiation

- Accept-Encoding / gzip handling

- Handling long-running or large HTTP responses

- API pagination and rate limiting

- Error handling and retry logic



Data Formats

- XML (strong experience)

- XML namespaces and sitemap schema structure

- JSON transformation

- CSV transformation (nice to have)

- Understanding of structured vs semi-structured data



Compression & File Handling

- Gzip (.gz) handling

- Binary file streams

- Base64 encoding/decoding

- MIME types and content types

- Understanding of how automation platforms store binary fields

- Decompression workflows in low-code environments



JavaScript / Scripting

- Strong JavaScript (Node.js context)

- Working within restricted runtime environments

- Buffer handling

- Debugging execution environments

- Familiarity with zlib and compression concepts (even if not directly usable)



Cloud & Serverless (Strongly Preferred)

- Cloudflare Workers

- AWS Lambda

- Lightweight proxy endpoints

- Writing minimal HTTP transformation services

- Deploying serverless scripts for file transformation

- Handling streaming responses



Data Processing & Pipelines

- Batch processing patterns

- Split-in-batches logic

- Memory-safe processing

- Idempotent job design

- Handling large sitemap trees

- Designing resilient ingestion pipelines



Debugging & Diagnostics

- Reading raw HTTP responses

- Debugging binary vs JSON mismatches

- Understanding how low-code tools represent internal data

- Inspecting request/response metadata

- Logging and tracing failures in automation platforms



Architecture Thinking

- When to process inside automation tool vs offload to serverless

- Trade-offs between low-code and custom code

- Designing reliable data ingestion systems

- Handling large structured public data sources (e.g., sitemaps)



Nice to Have

- Python (requests, gzip, lxml, BeautifulSoup)

- Experience scraping structured public datasets

- Experience with search engine sitemaps at scale

- Experience handling multi-level sitemap hierarchies

title: Virtual Assistant – Operations & Office Manager
description:
About Us



Boiler Medic is a busy UK-based plumbing and heating company providing boiler servicing, repairs, landlord gas safety certificates and maintenance for agents, landlords and homeowners. We are growing quickly and now require a high-calibre Virtual Assistant to manage the day-to-day office operations.



This is not a basic admin role. You will be responsible for running the office, answering calls, booking and allocating jobs, speaking with customers and engineers, and chasing payments. You will be the first point of contact for the business, so excellent spoken English is absolutely essential.



The Role



You will be fully responsible for:



Answering incoming phone calls from UK customers



Booking in jobs and allocating work to engineers



Managing daily schedules and engineer diaries



Speaking confidently with customers, tenants, landlords and estate agents



Chasing outstanding payments and overdue invoices



Handling
s, WhatsApp messages and customer enquiries



Following up on quotes, no-access jobs and cancellations



Updating CRM / job management systems accurately



Resolving customer issues calmly and professionally



This is a busy, high-responsibility role and requires someone who can think, prioritise and take ownership.



ESSENTIAL Requirements – Please Do Not Apply If You Do Not Meet These



This is very important. Please only apply if you meet all of the below:



Fluent, clear English 



Very confident speaking on the phone with customers



Experience chasing payments / debtors in a professional manner



Strong customer service skills – polite, calm and professional



Excellent organisation and attention to detail



Reliable internet connection and quiet home working environment



Available to work UK business hours



If you are not confident on the phone, struggle with English, or have only done basic admin/data entry roles, this role is not suitable.



Highly Desirable (Strong Advantage)



Experience working with UK companies



Background in plumbing, HVAC, property management or maintenance



Experience dealing with landlords, agents and tenants



Experience using job management or CRM systems



What We Are Looking For



We want someone who is:



Confident, proactive and takes ownership



Comfortable speaking to customers all day



Able to manage multiple engineers and busy schedules



Not afraid to chase payments and follow up firmly but politely



Reliable and looking for a long-term role



This role can grow into a senior operations position for the right person.



How to Apply – Very Important



To be considered, you must include:



A short video introduction in English (1–3 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining your experience



Confirmation of your experience with job allocation / scheduling / dispatch



Confirmation of your experience speaking to customers on the phone



Confirmation of your experience chasing payments or handling invoices



Applications without a video introduction will be automatically rejected.

title: Ecommerce Operations Manager – Take Over & Improve Founder-Led Shopify Operations
description:
We operate and scale fashion ecommerce dropshipping brands on Shopify, promoted organically on TikTok.



One of our brands has built a strong Trustpilot reputation and a loyal base of returning customers. We are growing steadily and plan to launch additional stores this year.



The founder is currently managing core operational systems, and we are now looking for an Ecommerce Operations Manager who can take over these systems and improve them progressively.



This is a hands-on ownership role inside a growing ecommerce business.



You will not be starting from zero — you will be taking over existing systems and making them stronger over time.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You will take over the day-to-day operational systems currently managed by the founder and improve them step by step.



This is not a beginner VA role, and it is not a corporate executive role either.

It is a hands-on ownership role inside a growing ecommerce business.



Your responsibilities include:



-Managing communication and coordination with multiple Chinese suppliers

-Ensuring orders are fulfilled correctly and on time

-Preventing wrong fulfillment and reducing operational mistakes

-Tracking and improving dispute handling and refund decisions

-Overseeing Trustpilot reputation management

-Supervising and improving the work of our Customer Support VA

-Maintaining operational trackers and reports

-Improving SOPs gradually as the business grows

-Identifying small system improvements that reduce errors and increase efficiency



You are not expected to rebuild everything immediately.

You are expected to understand the current systems, take ownership, and improve them progressively.



This role requires structure, accountability, and a long-term mindset.



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR



-Someone with Shopify ecommerce experience

-Someone who has handled suppliers or fulfillment before

-Someone who has dealt with disputes or refunds

-Someone who has supervised at least one tea
mber (even a small team)

-Someone organized, calm, and analytical

-Someone ambitious and ready to grow with the company



You do not need to have managed large teams or complex enterprise systems.



WHAT WE OFFER



-Hourly rate: 8 USD/hour 

-Full-time, long-term role

-Direct collaboration with the founder

-Opportunity to grow into a larger operations leadership role as we expand



We value consistency, ownership, and long-term collaboration.



HOW TO APPLY (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)



To apply, please follow these steps:



1) Change your application subject to:



“I want to take ownership of your operations Z”



2) Short Written Introduction (4–6 sentences)



Briefly explain:



-Your relevant ecommerce experience

-The approximate monthly revenue of the store you were most recently responsible for

-One operational responsibility you personally owned



3) Send your CV



4) Send a Loom video (3–5 minutes)



In your Loom, please answer the following:



1. Brief Background (1 minute)

-What type of ecommerce store have you worked on?

-What was the approximate monthly revenue?

-What were you personally responsible for?

title: Structural Engineer
description:
Location: Work from Home



Type of Employment: Full-time



Work Shift: USA Business Hours



Position Overview:



We are seeking a highly skilled Structural Engineer fluent in Metal Structures and Wood Frame Structures for Residential and Commercial Real Estate projects. The ideal candidate will have substantial experience in structural engineering, particularly in designing steel and wood frame structures for the real estate industry.



Responsibilities:



Design a new 14 ft x 24 ft steel frame:

Carry a 15K - 20K lbs modular housing structure from factory to foundation on a flat-bed truck.

Ensure the frame withstands the stress of 2-point loading (spanning 24ft) within 1-inch deflection at mid-point during the lift procedure from 6 inches above floor to truck bed height of 32 inches above grade via a tilt-bed truck.

Ensure the frame withstands loading at the factory to unloading to foundation in the field (32 inches above grade to 20 inches above grade).

Design a steel frame structure that is lightweight and easy to fabricate, requiring less than 30 man-hours (of cutting, drilling, welding, etc.).

F40 - Strengthen existing 12 ft x 40 ft steel chassis design:

Re-engineer existing steel frame chassis structures to reduce deflection at midpoint during the lift procedure.

Address current deflection issues that cause damage to the finished interiors of the residential unit (drywall cracking, buckling).

14x24 Foundation - with PE Seal:

Design and seal (if possible) reinforced concrete strip pier foundations for 14 ft x 24 ft modular housing units.

Utilize examples of existing 12 ft x 40 ft foundations as references.

14x24 First & Second Story:

Provide structural/architectural construction details for the first floor (module 1) to support the second floor (module 2).

Ensure modules are constructed in the modular building factory, shipped to the site, and the second floor is lifted by crane to sit upon the first floor module.

R32 Gable Roof Design:

Develop structural design details for a gable roof with a peak at midpoint (longitudinally) that supports all live and static loads when mounted on the foundation and withstands transitory stresses during the loading/unloading process and shipping across highways in Texas.

R32 Pop-up Roof Structural:

Create modular roof and side wall elements that allow transporting modular units with the roof element laying flat with a maximum package height of 12 ft (grade to highest point) and be able to lift the roof elements into place on a pivot to full height (height to be designed) in the field.

Ensure finish construction fixes the structure into place, weatherproofs and seals, and completes the finish-out of the final unit (unit will be strapped to the foundation - not to be moved again).

Top Deck Weatherproofing System:

Create the proper structural and architectural details required for a rooftop deck above the modular housing that is weather-tight and low maintenance.

Ideal Candidate Requirements:



Primary Experience:



Structural Engineer:

Professional Engineer

Has direct work experience in Structural Engineering for a USA-based Client.

Experience in completing structural designs for both steel and wood frame structures in the real estate industry.

Access to necessary tools to perform load calculations for all types of materials.

Ability to translate designs into layman's terms, detailed specifications, and resulting plans for metal fabrication.

Direct work experience with USA firms preparing design submittals for construction preferably in Texas.

Secondary Experience:



Architectural Engineering:

Familiarity with USA residential and commercial housing projects.

Ability to read, revise, and publish architectural plans.

Has experience working as an architect or for a USA-based architect.

Access to necessary tools to read and create construction drawings in CAD, AutoCAD, Revit, etc.

Benefits:



Permanent work from home

Ongoing training and professional development opportunities

Collaborative and supportive work environment

Competitive salary

title: Expert Accessibility Specialist (Web + Strong Mobile Expertise | US Standards)
description:
We are seeking an Expert Accessibility Specialist with at least 5+ years of professional experience in web development and accessibility implementation, including strong hands-on mobile application expertise.



This role requires a senior professional who can independently conduct accessibility audits and directly remediate issues in both web and mobile application code, ensuring full compliance with United States accessibility standards.



This is not a documentation-only role. We are hiring a true expert who can audit, fix, test, and deploy.



Required Expertise

Experience Requirements

• Minimum 5+ years of professional experience in web development

• Minimum 3+ years implementing accessibility compliance in production environments

• Proven experience implementing WCAG Level AA and AAA in live systems



US Accessibility Standards

• Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

• Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act

• WCAG 2.1 / WCAG 2.2 compliance



Highest Accessibility Level:

? WCAG Level AAA

Minimum requirement: WCAG Level AA compliance



Technical Requirements (Mandatory)

Web Accessibility & Development

• Strong experience in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript

• Experience with React, Angular, or Vue

• Proper semantic structure and ARIA implementation

• Keyboard navigation and focus management

• Experience fixing accessibility issues in production web systems



Strong Mobile Application Expertise (Required)

• Experience developing mobile applications using Swift or Kotlin

• Experience with React Native or Flutter (preferred)

• Implementation of VoiceOver (iOS) and TalkBack (Android)

• Accessibility labels, traits, content descriptions

• Focus management and logical navigation

• Proven experience fixing accessibility issues directly in mobile app source code

Strong mobile accessibility experience is required for this role.



Accessibility Testing Tools

• Experience using Axe, Lighthouse, WAVE, or similar tools

• Manual screen reader testing (JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver, TalkBack)

• Keyboard-only testing



Responsibilities

• Conduct full accessibility audits for web and mobile applications

• Identify ADA and WCAG violations

• Directly remediate accessibility issues in source code

• Refactor components to meet WCAG AA or AAA compliance

• Perform manual and automated accessibility testing

• Prepare accessibility compliance documentation (including VPAT when required)

• Collaborate with developers and designers to integrate accessibility best practices



Preferred Qualifications

• CPACC certification preferred

• IAAP certification is a plus

• Experience working with US-based clients

• Experience preparing VPAT documentation



Important



We are specifically hiring an expert-level programmer who can:

? Audit

? Code

? Fix

? Test

? Deploy

? Ensure compliance independently



If your experience is limited to reporting or documentation only, this role is not suitable.

title: Senior Backend / AI Systems Engineer
description:
We are building an AI-powered estimating system for the construction industry.



Phase 1 is focused strictly on doors and door frames only (no hardware in this stage).



We need a senior backend engineer to design and build the full estimating engine that takes architectural PDFs and produces a structured, ready-to-send quote.



You will own the backend system from plan upload through to final quote output.



Your Responsibilities:



• Build the document intake pipeline (PDF upload, storage, processing)

• Integrate OCR (Textract or equivalent) to extract door schedule data

• Structure extracted data into clean, validated JSON objects

• Build a configurable rules engine for door and frame compatibility

• Implement supplier-specific pricing logic

• Apply fire-rating logic, size-based pricing, and validation checks

• Build the pricing engine (cost, markup, totals, GST)

• Generate structured quote output (JSON + CSV)

• Flag missing or low-confidence data for review

• Design clean, scalable APIs



You will be building:

	1.	Document Extraction Layer

	•	Extract door tag, size (H x W x T), fire rating, door type, frame type, quantity

	•	Handle inconsistent formatting

	•	Detect duplicates

	•	Score OCR confidence

	2.	Rules & Validation Engine

	•	Fire-rated doors require compliant frames

	•	Size compatibility checks

	•	Thickness compatibility

	•	Frame type compatibility

	•	Supplier-specific rule packs

	3.	Pricing Engine (Doors + Frames Only)

	•	Size-based pricing tables

	•	Fire-rating surcharges

	•	Markups

	•	Margin tracking

	•	Multi-supplier support



This is a backend architecture role. You will not be building UI components.



Required Experience:



• Strong Node.js or Python backend development

• Experience with AWS (S3, Lambda preferred)

• Experience integrating OCR or document AI tools

• Experience building rule-based systems

• Experience building pricing or quoting engines

• Strong API and JSON schema design



This is not a junior position. We are looking for someone who can design the system architecture and execute independently.



When applying, include:

	1.	Complex backend systems you have built

	2.	Experience with OCR or document extraction

	3.	Experience with pricing or rule engines

	4.	Your proposed tech stack

	5.	Estimated timeline to deliver Phase 1



We are building the core engine of the platform. It needs to be robust, scalable, and production-ready.

title: Graphic & animation - Digital Creator
description:
We are seeking a creative and committed Digital Creator with a strong foundation in both 2D and 3D animation (mainly 2D), a keen eye for design, and a passion for visual storytelling. The main focus of this role is editing modules and producing graphics that elevate our coaching content and programs.



As part of our creative team, you’ll help bring our educational materials and brand visuals to life — while maintaining alignment with our values of growth, compassion, courage, and resilience.



Key Responsibilities:

- Edit and refine module videos, including motion graphics and animations.

- Create eye-catching 2D and 3D animations for learning modules, social media, and digital campaigns.

- Design graphics, illustrations, and visual assets that reflect the brand aesthetic and enhance user engagement.

- Work closely with our Creative Director to translate ideas into visual form.

- Collaborate and iterate based on feedback — receptive to guidance and dedicated to improvement.

- Maintain organized project files and meet delivery timelines consistently.



Requirements

What We’re Looking For:

- Proficiency in 2D & 3D animation and relevant editing tools (e.g., After Effects, Blender, Cinema 4D, Premiere Pro, etc.).

- Strong graphic design sensibilities and comfort with visual storytelling.

- A self-starter who can manage time effectively within a 40-hour work week.

- Ability to take constructive feedback with openness and incorporate it into work.

- 100% commitment to delivering quality and growing with the team.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills — you contribute ideas and also listen to direction.

- Attention to detail, adaptability, and a willingness to learn and evolve.



Benefits

Flexible hours.

At Growing Being, our mission is to help people discover their true worth, heal their past, and unlock their full potential by guiding them to live with love, purpose, and wholeness. Our values are rooted in compassion, courage, joy, and resilience, and we foster a culture where personal growth isn’t just encouraged — it’s inevitable. We’re driven by a belief that transformation begins with inner healing and expression.

title: Paid Media manager (Meta and Tiktok ads)
description:
Paid Media Manager

Fashion E-Commerce Brand



About Us

We are a fast-growing fashion e-commerce brand selling premium bags across
, Instagram, TikTok, and marketplaces.

We are building for scale. Not vanity metrics. Not traffic for the sake of traffic. We are looking for a Paid Media Manager who understands that ads are not content distribution. Ads are revenue engines.



If you know how to turn spend into profit, keep reading.



What You’ll Own

You will be directly responsible for paid acquisition performance across:



• Meta Ads 
 and Instagram)

• TikTok Ads

• Google Ads (Search, Shopping, Performance Max) – upcoming expansion

• Campaign architecture and budget allocation

• Creative testing strategy with the content team

• Performance tracking and reporting





Monthly Deliverables (Non-Negotiable)

1. Meta & TikTok Ads Management



• Launch and manage TOF, MOF, BOF and retargeting campaigns

• Test new creatives weekly

• Monitor CTR, CPC, CPA, ROAS, frequency

• Kill underperformers fast and scale winners confidently

• Maintain clean naming conventions and tracking systems



2. Google Ads Setup & Management (Upcoming Expansion)



• Build full Google Ads account structure from scratch

• Install and verify GA4, Google Tag and conversion tracking

• Set up Google Shopping feed and product sync

• Launch branded and non-branded search campaigns

• Launch and optimize Performance Max

• Review search terms and optimize weekly



3. Budget & Performance Optimization

• Allocate monthly budget per channel strategically

• Improve blended CAC

• Track break-even ROAS and MER

• Identify weekly scaling opportunities



You must understand the difference between profitable scaling and reckless spending.



4. Creative Testing & Collaboration

• Provide weekly insights on winning hooks and angles

• Request 3 new variations per winning concept

• Suggest new data-backed angles

• Align campaigns with promotions and launches

• Attend 1 weekly performance call every Friday





Requirements

• 2+ years running Meta Ads

• Experience running TikTok Ads

• Experience setting up Google Ads (Search, Shopping, PMax)

• Strong grasp of CTR, CPA, ROAS, MER

• Experience with e-commerce brands

• Fluent English (written and spoken)



You should be comfortable working with numbers, not just creatives.



What You Get



• Full-time remote role

• ?40,000 per month (approx. $690 USD)

• High ownership and real impact

• Direct involvement in scaling a fashion brand



If you want to be part of building something serious and measurable, this is for you.



Application Instructions



Send the following:



1. Portfolio of ad accounts handled (screenshots of results)

2. Example of campaign structure you built

3. Confirmation that you’ve read the deliverables and are aligned with the salary

???? About Us

We are a fast-growing, US-based online store specializing in premium mobility equipment. From electric wheelchairs to advanced scooters and rehab aids, we offer life-enhancing solutions for people who need them most. We’ve been in the business for 2+ years, operate on a dropshipping model, and pride ourselves on excellent customer care, quality products, and efficiency.

 outreach and supplier communication

Availability during US business hours.

title: Retail & Distributor Outreach Assistant (Part-Time, Contractor) plus commissions & bonuses
description:
About the Role



I’m the founder of a growing natural, vegan skincare and sunscreen brand based in the UK. I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented assistant to help manage outreach to retail stockists and distributors.



This role is suited to someone with sales or lead-generation experience who understands wholesale ecosystems and can confidently distinguish between brands, retailers/stockists, distributors, and competitors.



You’ll be responsible for keeping a high-quality outreach pipeline active and organised. I will handle closing and final negotiations.



Hours & Schedule



- Independent contractor role (hourly)



- Part-time: 12 hours per week



- Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday



- 4 hours per day



- Some overlap with UK business hours required



- Start date: ASAP



- Long-term role for the right person





Key Responsibilities



Outreach & Follow-Ups



- Send outreach
s to appropriate retail stockists and distributors



- Personalise
s thoughtfully (not mass outreach)



- Adapt and improve outreach templates over time



- Manage follow-ups and track responses clearly





Lead sourcing & tracking



- Track every account in a simple pipeline tracker or spreadsheet



- Correctly classify leads as:

   

        - Company-Sourced (we provide the target company; you find contacts and manage follow-up)

        - Assistant-Sourced (you independently identify a suitable retail stockist or distributor)



- Use judgement to flag borderline, strategic, or unsuitable accounts before outreach



- Confirm sourcing status in the tracker if unclear before spending time on it





Sales Cycle & Pipeline Support



- Support the sales process from prospecting to warm lead handover



- Qualify retailers and distributors based on brand fit



- Maintain clear notes on outreach status and next steps





Research & Prospecting



- Research and identify genuine multi-brand retail stockists and aligned distributors



- Identify correct buyers, founders, or category contacts



- Build and maintain a curated outreach list (quality over volume)





Communication & Reporting



- Clearly summarise replies and actions required



- Flag interested or time-sensitive leads promptly



- Maintain an organised spreadsheet or CRM





Requirements



- Experience in wholesale sales, B2B outreach, account management, or lead generation



- Clear understanding of the difference between:



            - brands vs retailers/stockists

            - competitors vs wholesale accounts

            - boutiques vs large chains



- Understanding of the sales cycle and follow-up process



- Strong written English



- Excellent organisation and attention to detail



- Confident researching companies and decision-makers



- Comfortable using Google Sheets and/or CRMs (PipeDrive a plus)



- LinkedIn outreach experience preferred





What This Role Is Not



- No cold calling



- No closing or negotiation



- No aggressive sales tactics





Tools



-  Gmail



- Google Sheets or CRM (PipeDrive)



- Templates, training, and brand materials provided



- Hubstaff used for time tracking (not micromanagement)





Pay



- PHP 250/hour, paid monthly



- Commission applies to the first paid order only from Assistant-Sourced accounts



- One-off bonuses apply to Company-Sourced accounts



- Commission/bonuses paid after cleared payment is received



(At 12 hours/week, approx. PHP 12,900/month + bonuses.)



How to Apply



 
 with ref SO26 and include:



- A short summary of your experience with sales, outreach, or wholesale support



- How you track outreach and follow-ups



- A short sample outreach
 introducing a natural skincare brand to a retail stockist



-A 1–2 minute Loom video explaining why you’re interested in this specific role and Baie Botanique



NB: Applications without a Loom link will not be reviewed.

title: Short form Video Editor
description:
Part-Time Probation ? Full-Time Opportunity



Black Sheep Media is a Scotland-based creative agency producing structured short-form brand content and paid ads for service-based businesses.



We are hiring a high-level short-form video editor to join our team on a part-time probation basis, with a clear path to full-time employment.



This is a long-term position inside a growing agency. Not a casual freelance role.



The three editors we hired two years ago are still with us today, working full-time in the company. We build long-term teams.



About The Role:



You will be editing structured short-form brand content designed for performance.



Platforms include Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts, with occasional long-form YouTube projects.



You will work with professional camera footage. This is not iPhone-only content.



Key Responsibilities



• Edit structured short-form brand and paid ad content

• Work confidently with professional camera footage

• Grade log footage including S-Log, C-Log and similar profiles

• Apply manual colour grading with consistency

• Build strong hooks and retention-focused pacing

• Add clean, on-brand captions

• Execute high-quality sound design

• Deliver the equivalent of 10-20 short-form edits per week

• Maintain a 1-week turnaround per 10-15 edits

• Implement feedback quickly and accurately



Software Requirements



Adobe Premiere Pro is mandatory.



After Effects experience is highly desirable.



We do not use CapCut or mobile editing software.



You must be competent grading professional log footage. If your experience is mainly template edits or iPhone-only content, this role is not suitable.



Requirements



• Strong short-form portfolio showing retention structure

• Consistent colour grading across projects

• Excellent attention to detail

• Strong written and spoken English

• Creative within structured briefs

• Able to work independently without constant supervision

• Reliable internet and communication

• You personally complete all editing work. No outsourcing permitted



Who This Is For



This role is for editors who want to build a long-term career inside a serious agency.



We are looking for someone who wants stability, responsibility, and growth as we scale.



If you are looking for basic editing tasks or short-term freelance work, this will not be the right fit.



Employment Structure



• Part-time probation period

• Paid test phase

• Clear performance targets

• Transition to full-time for the right candidate



Hiring Process



We follow a structured multi-stage process:



Portfolio review



Official application form



First test edit



Paid second test



Founder call



Final approval and onboarding



A test edit is mandatory.



If you are not willing to complete a test edit, you will not be considered.



We only move forward with editors who complete each stage properly and meet our standards.



Application Instructions



To apply, send:



Your portfolio link



Confirmation you edit in Adobe Premiere Pro



Confirmation you are confident grading log camera footage



Confirmation you personally complete all editing work



Please include your portfolio with your best work



Include the word “black sheep” in your message to confirm you have read this properly



We pay strong rates for strong editors.



If you want to grow inside a serious agency and build a long-term career, we want to see your best work.

title: Dispute Manager for Ecom Fashion Store
description:
Hey there!



We’re looking for a Dispute Manager to join our Ecom Fashion Dropshipping Store.



We’re a fast-growing e-commerce company operating in the USA market, currently processing around 50+ orders per day.

This is a key backend position — you’ll be fully responsible for handling, managing, and winning disputes, while also preventing them from happening again.



We’re building a long-term team of A-players who want to grow with us — not just for a few weeks, but for the long run.



What We’re Looking For:



Minimum 1 year of experience successfully handling disputes in e-commerce or fashion dropshipping.

Proven experience winning disputes and building strong evidence-based cases.

Familiar with dispute reasons such as wrong sizing, long shipping times, poor quality, and miscommunication.

Ability to collect, structure, and submit strong evidence (e.g., tracking info, customer communication, product photos).

Experienced in working with payment platforms (PayPal, Stripe, Shopify Payments, etc.).



Strong communication skills for coordinating with:



The Order Issue Manager

The Customer Support team

The Supplier

Fluent in English for clear documentation and communication.

Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented — you take ownership of every case.

Availability to work in the [insert timezone] timezone.



 Your Main Tasks:



Manage all incoming disputes from payment processors.

Investigate each dispute carefully and collect relevant evidence.

Build detailed dispute cases with screenshots, tracking, communication logs, and delivery proof.

Submit cases on time and follow up until each one is resolved.

Work directly with Customer Support and Order Issue Management to fix recurring causes.

Communicate with suppliers to verify shipment and product quality details.

Track dispute statistics and keep an internal record of all cases and results.

Implement prevention strategies to reduce future disputes.



Compensation & Bonuses:



Base pay depending on experience.

Bonus structure for each won dispute — paid per successful case.

Weekly or bi-weekly payouts (depending on agreement).



What We Offer:



Long-term position (we’re looking for someone to stay 6+ months minimum).

A structured environment with clear SOPs and templates for dispute handling.

Communication and task management via Slack.

Collaboration with a strong, professional team.

Growth opportunities as we expand into multiple stores and markets.



What to Expect After You Apply:



If we think you’re a fit, we’ll send you a short video explaining exactly how we work, what your daily tasks will look like, and what we expect from you.

After watching the video, you can respond with your thoughts — and if it feels like a good match, we’ll schedule a call to discuss the next steps.



 Important

title: Inbound Sales/Phone Attendant
description:
Job Title:



Customer Service & Phone Attendant VA (US-Accent Preferred)



About Us



We are a fast-growing U.S.-based cleaning company providing residential, commercial, and short-term rental cleaning services. We are looking for a reliable, professional Virtual Assistant to act as our front-line phone attendant and customer service representative.



This role is very light work most of the day, but requires someone who is calm, confident, and professional when calls or messages do come in.



Schedule (IMPORTANT – Please Read)



Coverage Needed: Monday–Sunday



Time Window: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM (US Eastern Time)



Workload is light, with downtime between calls/messages



We are open to:



One full-time VA with split shifts



OR two VAs covering different portions of the day



???? Please state your preferred availability in your application.



Primary Responsibilities



Answer inbound phone calls professionally



Handle customer questions, scheduling requests, and concerns



Calm and professionally handle upset or frustrated customers



Convert inbound leads into bookings



Respond to:



Gmail messages



Website inquiries



Yelp messages



Manage scheduling and notes in ZenMaid (training provided if needed)



Follow scripts and SOPs while thinking independently





What We’re Looking For (Non-Negotiable)



Clear, neutral, or American-sounding English



Confident speaking on the phone



No noticeable call delay or echo



Strong written English



Calm under pressure and emotionally mature



Fast learner with good common sense



Reliable internet and professional headset



Prior phone or call-center experience



Customer service or appointment-setting background



Scheduling software experience (ZenMaid, Launch27, Jobber, etc.)



Experience handling complaints or refunds





Compensation



Competitive monthly pay based on experience



Paid consistently and on time



Long-term opportunity for the right person



Raises and bonuses based on performance





Application Instructions (IMPORTANT)



To be considered, you MUST include the following:



A 60–90 second voice recording:



Introduce yourself



Explain how you would handle an angry customer complaining about a missed cleaning



Your internet speed (download/upload)



Your headset model



Your availability within 8am–7pm EST





Applications without a voice recording will not be considered.





Why This Role Is Great



Light daily workload



Stable, long-term position



Clear expectations and scripts



Supportive team



Opportunity to grow with the company

title: Legal Billing and Document Specialist
description:
Job Summary:



The Legal Billing and Document Specialist is a critical role responsible for ensuring the accurate and timely financial tracking, documentation, and organizational support necessary for the firm’s litigation practice. This position requires meticulous attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and proficiency in specialized legal software to manage time entry, billing, document control, and critical deadline calendaring.



Key Responsibilities:



Billing & Time Entry

* Enter attorney time into the billing system (Timeslips), including time spent on
s, document review, drafting, research, and other billable tasks.

* Save documents to the appropriate client file and ensure they are billed when applicable 
 attachments, pleadings, motions, orders, discovery documents, etc.)

* Bill cost logs to client files in Timeslips, including postage, copies, FedEx, and other firm expenses.

* Enter and bill Westlaw research costs.



Document Management & File Organization

* Save, label, and organize electronic documents to the correct client folders.

* Identify the correct case for each document received and match it to the corresponding client file with accuracy and consistency.

* Organize case files in preparation for hearings, depositions, and trials, including creating digital folders and ensuring all required materials are included.

* Create and label digital exhibit binders for hearings and trials.



Calendaring

* Calendar all case-related deadlines, including those contained in trial orders and other court notices.

* Track and maintain upcoming deadlines and notify attorneys of due dates, requirements, and approaching tasks.

* Calendar hearings, meetings, attorney appointments, and litigation events as required.



Qualifications:

* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.

*  Experience in a law office is preferred, especially with billing systems such as Timeslips (REQUIRED)

* Ability to follow detailed procedures for saving, labeling, and billing documents.

* Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple deadlines.

* Familiarity with legal documents (pleadings, motions, discovery) is a plus.

* Proficiency with Microsoft Office, PDF editing tools, and document management systems.

* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.

title: Production Designer
description:
Job Description:



We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Production Designer to support our Art Director and Lead Graphic Designer. This role is crucial for the efficient and high-quality build-out of various design services across our supported platforms: Google Ads, NGMT, and Template Websites.

The main focus of this position involves leveraging Adobe XD and Adobe Illustrator for production work. Experience with Figma is a valuable secondary asset.





Key Responsibilities:



* Templated Design Production: Execute and finalize templated design materials, including:

1. Creating CLM eblast PDF designs.

2. Designing all necessary
 assets for eblasts (CLM weekly, webinars, Sam Sum, etc.).

3. Building out secondary website pages based on established templates.

4. Performing customizations and edits on existing landing pages.

* Ad Production & Resizing: Efficiently manage and execute display ad and NGMT ad resizing, requiring good judgment to maintain design integrity across various dimensions.

* Quality Assurance (QA): Conduct thorough design quality assurance checks on website designs to ensure accuracy and consistency.

* Custom Build-Outs: Execute secondary page build-outs for custom website projects, applying the initial mockup style consistently.

* Documentation: Maintain clean, organized design files and adhere to established file naming and organization conventions.





Key Qualifications:



* Expert Software Proficiency (Primary Focus): Must have strong working expertise in Adobe XD and Adobe Illustrator for production, layout, and asset creation.

* Software Proficiency (Secondary): Proficiency in Figma is a highly desirable asset.

* Design Principles: Must possess a solid understanding and practical application of core design principles, including:

1. Type design and typography.

2. Color theory.

3. Messaging hierarchy.

4. Effective use of white space.

* Design Interpretation & Application: Ability to interpret the initial website design mockup and apply that consistent style to the entire website design, including desktop and mobile responsive applications.

* Critical Thinking: Must be able to make sound judgment calls when resizing display ads and proactively problem-solve production issues.

* Professional Skills: Must be an excellent communicator, capable of working well under pressure and managing tight deadlines without compromising design quality.

title: CORE CRM Software Specialist (Timekeeping & Billing)
description:
Role Overview:

We are seeking an experienced CORE CRM Specialist to own and manage the firm’s use of the CORE platform, with an initial focus on timekeeping and billing. This role is critical to ensuring accurate time tracking, clean billing workflows, and reliable reporting across the business.



Beyond day-to-day execution, the ideal candidate will bring deep CORE experience and act as a strategic partner—helping the firm expand its use of CORE’s features, improve internal workflows, and increase operational visibility and efficiency.



This role is well-suited for someone who is highly detail-oriented, process-driven, and enjoys optimizing systems.



Key Responsibilities: 



CORE CRM Ownership (Primary Focus): 

* Serve as the primary owner and subject-matter expert for the CORE CRM system

* Manage and maintain accurate time tracking across projects and tea
mbers

* Oversee billing and invoicing workflows within CORE

* Ensure consistency, accuracy, and timeliness of time entries and billing data

* Troubleshoot issues related to CORE usage and workflows

* Maintain data integrity and system hygiene



Reporting & Insights:

* Generate and maintain reports related to:

1. Time utilization

2. Billing and revenue

3. Project performance

* Provide leadership with clear, reliable operational data

* Help identify trends, gaps, and opportunities for improvement



Process Improvement & System Expansion: 

* Evaluate current CORE usage and recommend enhancements

* Help implement additional CORE functionality as appropriate

* Document best practices and internal workflows related to CORE

* Train or support tea
mbers on proper CORE usage

* Act as a bridge between operations, leadership, and finance-related processes



Cross-Functional Support: 

* Collaborate with the Admin Assistant, Director, and CEO as needed

* Support project teams in accurate time and data entry

* Assist with onboarding new users into CORE





Ideal Candidate Profile:

* Highly analytical, detail-oriented, and process-driven

* Comfortable owning and improving a core business system

* Clear, professional communicator

* Proactive and solution-oriented

* Trustworthy and comfortable handling financial and operational data

We are seeking a Creative "Hunter"—a high-output professional who combines artistic excellence with strategic marketing execution. This is not an admin role; this is a growth role. You will report directly to the CEO, serving as the creative engine of the organization. Your job is to take the CEO's vision and instantly translate it into stunning visuals,

high-converting funnels, and compelling narratives.



The "Big 3" Priorities

1. World-Class Design: You don't just use templates; you create brand experiences using Canva and Photoshop.

2. Funnel Architecture: You know how to build systems 
 + Social) that turn followers into donors/supporters.

title: Car Sales Expert
description:
Position Overview:



We are seeking a high-caliber Virtual Assistant in the Philippines with deep experience in the car sales industry, someone who understands the dealership world, sales funnels, lead handling, automotive customer psychology, and dealership events.

This role is designed for a business-minded, entrepreneurial individual who wants to grow into building a Philippine-based automotive sales & marketing operation. You will be mentored, trained, and developed to run dealership events, manage and convert leads, build ads, and help expand a scalable business unit. This is NOT a standard VA role. This is a pathway to leadership and possibly to head a division.





Key Responsibilities:



1. Car Sales & Lead Management

* Handle inbound dealership leads from ads, events, and outreach.

* Qualify, nurture, and convert leads into sales appointments.

* Understand car buyer objections and help move deals forward.

* Maintain a strong follow-up rhythm (SMS, calls, messenger, CRM).

* Provide dealership-style customer experience through digital channels.



2. Dealership Event Support (Vendor-Style Role)

* Coordinate dealership sales events (online & onsite support).

* Assist with vendor preparation, event promotions, and logistics.

* Engage with potential buyers during live events via chat, call, or messaging.

* Help gather attendee lists, follow-ups, and post-event analytics.



3. Automotive Ads Creation & Campaign Support

* Build and post ads for dealership offers, specials, inventory, and promos.

* Work with templates or create simple, compelling ad graphics.

* Manage ad placement strategies across FB/Marketplace and PH-based channels.

* Track ad performance and optimize lead flow.



4. Business Development & Entrepreneurial Execution

* Think like a business owner — not just a task-taker.

* Identify opportunities in the Philippines automotive market.

* Build relationships with PH dealerships, vendors, and potential partners.

* Contribute ideas to grow a scalable car-sales-focused business line.

* Receive mentorship in business building, sales strategy, and leadership.



5. Communication & Coordination

* Attend training and mentorship calls to sharpen automotive and business skills.

* Communicate progress clearly, proactively, and professionally.





Required Background:



* Experience working in car dealerships, auto sales, or automotive lead handling (PH experience strongly preferred).

* Comfortable with sales conversations, appointment-setting, and overcoming buyer objections.

* Understanding of dealership operations, car buying processes, promotions, inventory, and basic pricing structures.



Entrepreneurial Characteristics:

* Wants to build something bigger than a job.

* Has natural business instincts and enjoys creating value.

* Sees the car industry as an exciting long-term opportunity.

* Interested in becoming a future business leader or division head.



Skills & Attributes:

* Strong English communication (written and spoken).

* Confident, proactive, resourceful, and exceptionally organized.

* Comfortable with digital tools: CRMs,
 Marketplace, Messenger, phone calls, spreadsheets, simple design tools.

* Creative eye for ads & promotions.

* Learns quickly and adapts to new systems.





Growth Path (What Makes This Role Special)



Phase 1: Learn & Execute

* Lead handling

* Ads creation

* Event support

* Dealership coordination



Phase 2: Operate Like a Sales Director

* Manage multiple dealership pipelines

* Build revenue

* Track KPIs

* Generate local PH dealership deals



Phase 3: Become the next expert

* Build your own business unit inside the automotive niche

* Mentor additional VAs

* Lead dealership events as the main vendor

* Become the face of the PH automotive expansion



This is for someone who wants a career, not just a role

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 3a
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 





CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education

title: Sales Manager
description:
Key Outcomes 

? Drive Monthly Revenue Growth 

Own and exceed monthly new client acquisition targets through a combination of outbound sales, inbound lead conversion, and referral growth. Grow Moonlight’s client base to 50+ active clients within the first 12 months. 

? Build a Scalable Sales Process 

Design and document a scalable, repeatable sales playbook tailored to Moonlight’s services and market. This includes outreach scripts,
 sequences, objection-handling guides, CRM flows, and handoff procedures. 

? Optimize Conversion Across Funnel 

Identify and optimize the highest-performing messaging, offers, and channels across the full sales funnel. Increase lead-to-close conversion rate by 30% within six months. 

? Establish and Track Sales Metrics 

Define key sales metrics (e.g., cost per acquisition, lead response time, close rate, churn rate). Build and manage dashboards to track performance weekly and use insights to make iterative improvements. 

? Improve Retention Through Sales Alignment 

Ensure a high-quality match between clients and services through expectation-setting and qualification. Contribute to reducing client churn by 20% by aligning sales with client success criteria. 

? Lay the Foundation for Sales Team Growth 

Within 6–9 months, identify and recommend future sales hires or contractors as demand grows. Build the foundation for a future sales organization, including roles, structure, and performance standards. 



Qualifications 

? 5-7+ years of experience in a sales, growth, or business development role, ideally in a fast-paced startup or service-based business 

? Proven track record of exceeding sales targets and closing high-value clients through outbound channels 

? Deep understanding of sales psychology, lead qualification, and consultative selling 

? Experience designing or optimizing a high-converting sales funnel — from cold outreach to contract 

? Strong proficiency with CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Pipedrive) and sales automation tools ? Excellent verbal and written communication skills — persuasive, clear, and human 

? Highly analytical and data-driven with the ability to identify drop-off points and improve conversion rates 

 Creative thinker who enjoys testing and iterating on outreach strategies, messaging, and formats

? Comfortable collaborating with marketers, operators, and leadership to align growth across functions 

? Thrives in a lean, early-stage environment with high autonomy and a bias toward action 

? Excellent project management and organizational abilities; adept at balancing multiple priorities under tight timelines. 

? Comfort and skill in working remotely with distributed, multicultural teams 



Compensation, Growth, and Benefits 

? Competitive compensation commensurate with experience 

? Opportunity for performance-based bonuses as the company grows 

? 21 days of paid time off including the US Holidays

? Philippines 13th month end of year bonus
